source.name: Finch & Fork
source.categories: Breakfast & Brunch, American (New), Restaurants, American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars

review_info.review_text:
What a great brunch. A couple days ago my wife randomly decided she'd book a hotel in Santa Barbara for the weekend. She said she had already found a good spot for brunch Sunday morning. Usually I plan all the trips so she had a lot of pressure not to disappoint. And... she did not. Moral of the story: here we are now, just enjoyed a delicious breakfast burrito (her) and steak/eggs/frites (me). Most importantly the "mimosa madness" was served just the way I like it, just a splash of juice. This may have influenced this review :)
Our server Jamie was awesome and very hospitable. 5 stars for food, ambiance, and service. We'll be back some day.
main downside is that the food was overpriced. taste and quality of the food was great and service was also good. ambiance is nice, the restaurant is located in a hotel lobby.

The best bottomless brunch! $14 for the first mimosa, and $1 for every mimosa after that. 

We came on a Sunday for brunch and we didn't have to wait which was nice. The restaurant is inside a VERY nice hotel, and I was shocked at how cheap the menu is, given how nice the ambiance is. 

Our server Matthew was great. We were in SB for the day and he was giving us tips on what to do & where to go. He was very outgoing & kind, and the service was fast and on point. 

The food was good as well, I got the eggs benedict and it was filling & delicious. The mimosas were BOMB and so cheap... we paid only $16 each for bottomless! They also have different flavors: orange, grapefruit, and poinsettia/cranberry which were all v tasty. 

DEFINITELY recommend this place to anyone looking for a good bottomless brunch!

source.name: Tinker's Burgers
source.categories: Burgers, Restaurants

review_info.review_text: My husband and I came to Tinkers for the first time about a month ago and we have become regulars. Today we ordered a Sourdough Bacon Cheeseburger and a double cheeseburger with an egg. Best burgers we've ever had!! Thank you Tinkers.

I really wanted this placed to be great, unfortunately that was not the case. There were two orders a head of mine yet it took approximately 30 minutes to prepare two burgers, fries and a corn dog. The food was good, but not above average. All that being said, I would've returned if the service had been better. Not only did the food take forever, but I practically had to beg the cashier for extra ketchup which was ridiculous considering there was only one small pre poured container in the bag. So was the person eating the corn dog supposed to dip their corn dog in the small container and the rest us just pass it around sparingly? The cashier just passive aggressively stared at me and blinked multiple times when I asked for extra ketchup. Given that it's a small spot I even tipped on my order takeout order to help support small businesses. I wanted so badly for this to be my go spot, but given the excessive wait times, value for price and not so great service, it will instead be a one and done.

We stopped here on our way to LA and the food was just EXCELLENT!... the double cheeseburger and fries were superb!! as well as the freeze and malt... this is definitively a hidden gem in the small beach town of Summerland.

source.name: Benchmark Eatery
source.categories: American (Traditional), American (New), Breakfast & Brunch, Restaurants, Seafood, Vegetarian, Nightlife, Event Planning & Services, Bars, Venues & Event Spaces

review_info.review_text: Nice little place in downtown Santa Barbara where we stopped for late lunch/early dinner on our way back home to San Diego. We loved our flatbreads. I had been craving clam chowder and ordered it here. It was a little thick for my liking, but tasted good. Nice, friendly upscale casual place on State Street.

I had high hopes for this place, but it fell flat big time. I ordered the BLAT with grilled chicken and a side salad. I specifically asked for no tomato and they put tomato on both the sandwich and the salad. Not a huge deal, just annoying to pick it all off. And if you have an allergy, I would not trust this place to be mindful of that. The grilled chicken was not seasoned at all and the food overall was just extremely bland. My sandwich was stacked so high that the avocado all fell out as I was eating it. The side salad is lettuce, cucumber, red onion, and tomato. My bf got a burger with onion rings and he did not enjoy either part of the meal. The onion rings are beer battered and basically all batter. The burger was also unseasoned and not enjoyable. The service is ok. The staff is nice enough but my bf did have to get up and ask for his soda to be refilled and we were never offered a refill on our waters. We both left the restaurant with a stomach ache, I personally felt ill. I had stomach pains for a few hours afterwards and I can only assume it's because the food is not fresh because my meal didn't have any allergens that would've given me that reaction. Lastly, the cleaning spray they used on the tables just smelled funky. Idk how to explain it but we actually moved to an outside table because the inside one smelled so musty and mildewy.

The patio is nice, but not worth coming back for. Additionally, the menu is too scattered and overwhelming. I think they should stick to one type of food and work on increasing the quality rather than having too many different menu options that aren't cohesive.

We have been here a few times during trial over the past couple weeks and it is awesome.  I keep ordering the burrito but everyone seems to enjoy their food.  The one piece of feedback would be the Spanish soup seems to change - from not too spicy to spicy.

source.name: Pizza Mizza
source.categories: Food Delivery Services, Food, Restaurants, Pizza, Italian

review_info.review_text: Bummed only delivery now probably my favorite pizza in town everywhere else sucks and are making restaurants you feel like you almost have to dress up for now and over priced including the owners of Pizza Mizza new pizza restaurant on state

This pizza place is pretty average. They have a huge list of different kinds of pizzas, pastas, salads, and more! I recently tried to call an order in to pick up but was told they only do delivery right now so I ended up just doing delivery. I couldn't decide what to order with all of their different choices and sizes! They even have cauliflower and gluten free crust options!

I ended up getting the personal size Hawaiian pizza with a normal crust. It took about an hour to arrive at my house but when I finally got it I was so happy and hungry. The pineapple was fresh, along with the ham and the crust was cooked with the perfect amount of crisp! They also gave me multiple sides of ranch which I was stoked about since most places always never actually bring the ranch when you order it or give you only one.

They also gave me plates and cheese along with the hot peppers! Overall I had a great experience here getting delivery here and I can't wait to order them again! :)

I always wondered why this place had such average to low rating and after a few times of visiting this place, I can see why. Food is great! I have no complaints over their food. There used to be a Pizza Mizza in Ventura and I remember going there often so when I saw there was one in SB, I had to go give them a try.

As for customer service here...
I'm always left wondering if there's anyone in charge here or if any of the front staff even care about their job. This isn't my first time waiting here over 30minutes for food which is beyond ridiculous. I've ordered different things and they all take so long. I don't know if they're just short staffed but this is not acceptable in any restaurant business especially if this is a continuous problem. My boyfriend ordered a sandwich which they left sitting on their rack for 10min while my pasta was nowhere to be seen. I was sick of their tendency to just hang out, have conversations amongst each other, and not care about their hungry customers. I went to the front and asked them if that plate on the rack was for us and they said that it just came out and were waiting for my pasta to come out. That sandwich did NOT JUST come out but obviously they were too busy with their conversations to realize it was there. Whatever, I brought it to my table and we waited another 10 minutes for my pasta. I saw two plates again sitting on the rack for about 5mins and I told myself if none of those are mine, I'm going to leave. Well it turns out none of them were mine and one server who was aware of our situation came to notify us that due to the delay, he had refunded my entire bill. Great. So I'm still hungry. The food is most likely going to take more time. I got my money back. I'm not waiting anymore. So my boyfriend and I left. 

The food is so good that I would've given this place 5 stars but unfortunately, the staff is a big miss. Maybe management should train their staff again or hire people who actually care about their job.

source.name: Taffy's Pizza
source.categories: Restaurants, Pizza

review_info.review_text:
Bought a axxess card, they refused to accept it. Don't order the
chicken piccata, there., they declined it,,   Especially, when you go to pay, you pay full price. So why did I get the card, and pay $ 40.00
Will I go back,?  well as a first time customer, chances are. ZERO
No second chances, and I would have been a steady customer.

We love, love, love Taffy's! We've had almost everything on the menu and have enjoyed every bite. There's no doubt about it that Taffy's is our favorite pizza in town, but we also love the great beer selection, bread sticks, salads, pastas and sandwiches. 

They have a HUGE selection of pizza breads, veggies toppings, cheeses and meats. Because they have such a variety of toppings, their sandwiches, salads, etc. have a great selection of toppings too. I called and accidentally asked to order an antipasto salad, not realizing that they don't even have an antipasto salad on the menu. However, they have such amazing customer service, that they assured me they have everything to make a great antipasto salad delivered to my house. And they were right!! It was incredible. 

AND free delivery, but call early to place your order. It can take a little while depending on when you call. So worth it for free delivery!! 

Pre-Covid times, they offered fun events like trivia on their large, private outdoor patio. I hope they can start that up again soon. 

They also have a small arcade room and lots of children's books scattered here and there for the kiddos. Very family friendly!

Fantastic pizza. Have been coming to taffy's for 20 years since I was a teenager and now bringing my kids here. Love it. Good food at reasonable price. Classic arcade in the back with some of the same games for the last 20 years.

The great lunch specials, still listed on the website, are gone. The bread on my BLT seemed old and just pulled from the whole wheat wonderbread bag. There was only one choice for soup and it was done for the day. Really, no reason ever to come here again.

source.name: Sam's To Go
source.categories: Sandwiches, Restaurants, American (New)

review_info.review_text: This was our first time at Sams and it was delicious!! Excellent customer service, they were so sweet. We got the #11 Italian cold cuts, and the veggie sandwich #29 both were so good! The bread was so fresh and you could tell the ingredients were really quality! My daughter got the turkey sandwich and she is the pickiest eater and she loved it! Can't wait to go back

The couple who runs the place are so nice and funny, and the sandwiches are delicious. It doesn't look fancy, but do yourself a favor and try it out. The Pastrami Avocado and Cheese was delicious. Warning, the medium size sandwich is BIG.

I've been going to Sam's for the past several years while visiting beautiful Santa Barbara from the San Francisco Bay area. I've always enjoyed the sandwiches from Sam's. Unfortunately, my wife and I just finished eating their turkey sandwich and in all honesty, it' was just, Ok, more like disappointing...

We were disappointed because it appears the quality and taste of the sandwich has digressed to a "point of no return"... The sandwich was sloppily made, poorly wrapped, and importantly, the man behind the counter (usual guy) seems to have gotten cantankerous over time. He chastised me for not ordering both white and wheat bread sandwiches the way he wanted, getting perturbed for asking for olives in my sandwich and, he had a smart alec - bad attitude demeanor about him - poor customer service.

Suffice it to say, we will not be going back to Sam's. There are too many good delis in the Cliffs Dr. area to be subjected to poor quality sandwiches and an unpleasant customer experience...

review_info.review_text: so sad !!!! It was so good. If you open somewhere else will you let your fans know ! Loved your margarita flights ( the best fresh margaritas I have ever had ) and light fresh,flavorful  salads.

My husband got really bad food poisoning from this place. We ate there Friday evening and he's been vomiting etc since. He is currently in the ER for treatment. To top it off they dropped a plate and glass flew everywhere and cut my ankle.

We had our rehearsal dinner and welcome party here in July and it was so perfect!! We rented the upstairs space for the evening and had 30 guests for the rehearsal dinner and then the rest of the guests (about 75 people) joined after for drinks. The taco buffet was delicious!!! And the space was exactly what we wanted for our group.  Dina, the Events Coordinator, was incredibly helpful throughout our planning process, starting in January and right through the event itself. All of the staff here were amazing. I highly recommend this restaurant for anyone looking to host a similar event, or even for dinner - the food was amazing!!

review_info.review_text: I miss the old menu a lot! The staff here isn't as friendly and the bartenders drink on the job here including there bar manager! Where's Tom at to take control! Saw the manager tana take shots with employees and completely ignoring guest! Not okay!

So, so, so excited to have new chef and brand new menu. The favorites from the old still remain but they have been kicked up a notch in flavor. It was such a pleasant surprise and long overdue.

I get the Korean chicken wings. I can honestly say they are the best at Hollister and now the chicken comes juicy, not dry, and tons of flavor.

I love that Hollister makes their own dressings. I do like getting a salad every once in awhile.

My hubs was actually pleased with the change and finally enjoys eating there. We will be there today!

Hollister is conveniently located in a large shopping area and has an array of beers they brew right in the restaurant. Full bar and some wine to choose from.

Hollister has been a staple with my family and we are so happy there's a new menu. Give it a try!!

Waited 30min until asked to take our drink & food order. 
Very slow service, if your hungry don't expect to eat soon you will be waiting along time. We had kids and already sat down or else we would of left .

source.categories: Bakeries, Restaurants, Food, American (Traditional), Breakfast & Brunch, Coffee & Tea

review_info.review_text: I am super disappointed. I love the Jeannine's in Montecito. But this one is just not that great. Coffee is not great , I think the drink coffee is a good indicator on how serious a place takes their coffee and this place does not do great coffee. I ordered chilequiles and we super excited since I love that dish most places I go to but tbh it was the worst chilequiles I've ever had. The taste was bitter and even my dad who eats everything and is not picky didn't eat it. Also I asked specifically not to overlook my eggs, and they were overcooked. Bummer! Paid 7 for fresh OJ... also not tasty. Ordered French toast for my boy and it was definitely the best thing we ordered. I also got a croissant and I know this is brutal but Costco makes them better. Sorry guys I hate to be so negative but to spend 65 bucks on breakfast that was a MAJOR let down. I will not be going back.

Visiting from SF - this place is excellent. Don't be out off by it's location in a mall. 

The food and service are top notch and the decor inside is super cute. 

We had the French toast and Avo toast with matcha lattes made with oat milk. 

Everything was made perfectly and was really delicious. The eggs had deep Orange yolks and were also super tasty. 

Two thumbs up!

I absolutely love the ambiance, and the attentive service.
The french toast was delicious!
Fresh OJ gets a two thumbs up!
Now the bacon! I'd go there just for that! 
Smokey and crisp!
My friend had that All American and she was pleased!
Definitely on repeat! 
Thanks to everyone for a nice experience!

source.name: Holdren's Grill
source.categories: Seafood, American (New), Restaurants, Nightlife, Steakhouses, American (Traditional), Bars

review_info.review_text: I have to give this restaurant a 1-star rating purely due to horrible service. While the extremely pricey menu options were surprisingly good, the service in the whole restaurant was awful! Our server came to our table twice the entire night. Once to seat us, and once after we waited a very long time to get our check. He never came to check on us or ask how our food was even once! One table next to us even walked out before getting their food, or maybe they just never received it. A couple sat at the hostess stand for a good 10 mins before anyone greeted them as well. I'm surprised they didn't leave! It's too bad that the staff was so un attentive, because the food was actually pretty good! We will probably not be returning here:/

I frequent this location often on the weekends as a hang-out location with my friends. Over the many time I have been here, I have had a consistent experience with the food, the environment, as well as the service. 

When you open the menu, you will be quite surprised at the wide variety of choices available. Dishes range from crab-cakes to artichoke dips to filet mignons. Personally, I have tried the steaks many times at Holdrens, as well as a few of their select appetizers. The food is good for the price, typically around $20-$30 per individual (Combination of entree and appetizer). To me, having frequented many steakhouses in the United States such as Mastro's and Strip House, I would have to say that the quality and presentation of the slab of meat is on par with my expectations. It might be a little bit on the high side in terms of the food, but what can you expect, it is Santa Barbara. I expect the price to be more catered to the location when looking at the prices. Overall, I was happy with my food because it was delicious and I left the restaurant a happy customer. 

Many people on Yelp have been complaining about the poor service and lack of attention they received during their experience. During my few times at Holdren's, I have yet to encounter any problems. The service is excellent and attentive, and my table was always served and cared for properly. 

Overall, my experience at Holdren's was pleasant. I understand that it is located near Santa Barbara, which is prime real-estate. I expect many restaurants to institute a premium in their prices because of this. As a happy customer, I will continue to frequent this location with my friends when I do have the chance.

My family went there for my brother's birthday. The wait staff was polite and courteous but the food was terrible. The steaks were burnt and the fish was undercooked. My mom and I split the bill and they ended up charging me for the entire bill!  I spoke with the manager a few days later and she said she would refund the portion I didn't owe, and instead CHARGED me again. Thank god I had enough money in my account to cover the charges. My bill was $86 and instead I got charged twice for a total of $411.08. Ridiculous, they lost me and my family's business forever.

source.name: Uniboil
source.categories: Food, Bubble Tea, Chinese, Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Hot Pot

review_info.review_text:
I ate here three times already.

Parking is easy; there are plenty of spaces. They have both indoor and outdoor dining. The restaurant is connected to Phresh Tea (located on the right), and both use the same kitchen, so you can order Boba or anything on Phresh Tea menu while dining at Uniboil. 

Uniboil are known for their hotpots. They also have other dishes on the menu if you're not into that. The prices are reasonable, and the hotpot portion is huge; you could probably share it with another person if you aren't too hungry. 

I really enjoyed the Beef Thai Tom Yum Hotpot. I've also had the Korean Army Stew the first time my family and I went, and it was good; I do prefer the Thai one better though. I've tried the sizzling beef dish (forgot what is called), popcorn chicken, and beef noodle soup. Sizzling beef and popcorn chicken were fantastic. I didn't like the beef noodle soup. The broth tasted fine, but the meats were terrible. I didn't have any meats in my bowl actually; it was like just fatty parts. 

Customer service has been inconsistent; sometimes they're slow, and other times they're quick. Staffs are friendly though. They checked up on us all the time.

Their boba drink is surprisedly good, I have a high standard for boba, their boba is definitely above average. Try their kumquat drink, or milk drink with less sweet ( it could be really sweet ). As for their food, I ordered a noodle soup for my son, the soup is good but not the round noodle they use. Order their drink if you visit.

Felt weird vibes here. Was confused that it was also attached to the tea place next door and all the workers were more situated there. Thus it was a while and took effort to get a table at the restaurant side. Even tho there was only one other party there... 

We came for the beef noodle soup and coffee. The soup Is the first picture on Yelp and looked delicious. But upon ordering the waitress said they didn't have it. They had run out. Plus they didn't have coffee either. At the end we decided not to stay

I especially appreciate Juan who always prepares my Burrito in the way that I like it. He smiles when I arrive and remembers how I like my Chicken Burrito prepared! review_info.review_text: One of our favorite places to grab breakfast! They have a wide selection of donuts and their bagels are always tasty. I especially enjoy their homemade cream cheese flavors - I haven't had anything like them! Their vegetable cream had chopped up veggies in it and their strawberry cream cheese had jam. Definitely stop by to try some delicious bagel and cream cheese combo and donuts!

So happy to have stumbled upon this bagel place. I've had hundreds of NY bagels of the years but I'm telling you something about the bagels is special. I ordered the everything bagel with vegetable cream cheese and lox. Literal perfection. Had to stop again before we left.

Was in SB for the phish show 10/26. Trey and the boys laid it down, but the reason I was able to rokk was Spudnuts and Bagels. Had 3 of my 5 meals there while in town. The bagels are crispy but somehow airy not chewy! The ham and cheese filled croissant - get 2 or 3. The lady who was helping me was super nice and took the time to answer all my questions. When she found out i was flying her goods home to the fam she gave me some xtras she wanted them to try - thank you S&B!!

review_info.review_text:
A friend and I ate lunch at Mala Town today. We arrived at noon and were the only ones there. The large and lush patio was great since the weather was nice, and my bowl of spicy soup noodles hit the spot. 

I used to live in Hong Kong and have traveled in Asia quite a bit. While I can't quite call what I ate "traditional" in some respects, it was delicious. For around $11.80, I got a big bowl of tasty mala soup (at just the right spice level after I asked for it "da la" 大麻) with four ingredients. 

I chose vermicelli, broccoli, Chinese cabbage, and tofu rolls. Each was super tasty! I was a little disappointed as I had asked the friendly cashier/server if the tofu roll was the crispy beancurd roll from hotpot and he said yes, but it wasn't. It was more like rolled tofu skin--still tasty though. The broccoli was fresh and perfectly cooked, and the cabbage soaked up the delicious mala oils while the vermicelli provided the "umph" to the dish. The soup came topped with sliced spring onions and a generous dollop of chili sauce with sesame seeds. 

A little while into our meal, the server came over with two cups of mung bean soup for my friend and I. He said the chef had decided to make up a batch and gave it to us on the house. It was a nice balance of sweet to match the spicy soup, and had a liberal serving of perfectly cooked mung beans at the bottom. 

The only downside was the place's lack of nice utensils. Though I ordered my meal "for here," it came with a small plastic spoon and disposable wooden chopsticks. I carry my own chopsticks, so no worries there (BYO people, be green!), but the spoon was sad. I want to eat a lovely soup like that with a proper Chinese soup spoon that has room for me to arrange the perfect bite with my chopsticks. The silly little plastic one just didn't cut it. Despite that, I thoroughly enjoyed my lunch, and ate every bite. I think I'll be back; maybe I can try the jian bing (Chinese crepe) next time.

The food here is ok but not great, and kind of expensive for what it is. We tried both the mala tang and the dry pot (peanut-based sauce). The base is free, and you pay for the items you chose to add in (minimum of 4). They assemble your hot pot or dry hot pot in the kitchen before bringing it out in a regular bowl. The mala soup base was not very numbing, and the flavors of the base didn't seem very incorporated into the mix-ins.

They also have jian bing and some appetizers, which we didn't try--some of their other items may be better.
I believe the restaurant will not last long, even their food is not bad, because the price is much higher than expected.

source.name: Alchemy Wellness Spa
source.categories: Skin Care, Cafes, Fitness & Instruction, Vegan, Vegetarian, Active Life, Restaurants, Acupuncture, Health & Medical, Massage, Day Spas, Beauty & Spas, Weight Loss Centers, Yoga

review_info.review_text: Gorgeous setting for treatments and a cup of tea ~ if you've never tried a float tank before, I highly recommend it! Great way to meditate and relax. I was particularly impressed, however, with the lovely, heart-centered service. When I needed a place to nurse and change my infant I was beyond accommodated and made to feel very welcome. What a lovely experience!

I would highly recommend Danielle for facials to everyone I know. She did a phenomenal job and I came out looking much younger. The entire experience was fabulous from the front counter to the beautiful environment. Great job all thank you very much.

Horrible massage. We came here looking for a great massage and all we got was good decor. The cafe was good (between the two of us, we had coffee, tea, and oatmeal - oatmeal was good but nothing special). 

We had Lizzie who was supposed to "the best" massage therapist, but she definitely wasn't:
-The oil she used was cold - not a pleasant surprise to start off the massage.
-I got "deep tissue" ...I had to tell her twice for more pressure - shouldn't have to ask for that for a deep tissue massage. Even after asking for more pressure, she didn't do it. Come to find out, the person I came with who got a Swedish massage said Lizzie's pressure was weak and limp as well! From the way she timidly handled my head and neck to how I could uncomfortably feel her nails in my skin, everything screamed that Lizzie had either never given a massage before or was extremely inexperienced. 

SUCH a disappointment considering we were looking forward to a great massage AND considering we paid $135 EACH. Big disappointment.

source.name: Blaze Pizza
source.categories: Pizza, Gluten-Free, Salad, Restaurants, Fast Food

review_info.review_text:
Their pizzas are quite nice. Unlimited toppings for a personal size pizza is a model I personally love, especially since their pizzas are priced reasonably at just under $10. While Blaze is inferior to Pieology, it offers a nice alternative that is closer to campus for UCSB students. In terms of taste, Pieology is slightly better with their dough in that they brush it with a layer of oil before hand so the crust turns out more tasty and less dry. However, Blaze Pizza still taste great overall, especially if you take the time to build your own to your liking. Their Lemonade is also very nicely flavored. 

One issue I have with the store is that the floor is incredibly sticky during the time I went, which raises concerns about cleanliness.

I just want to warn everyone that NO ONE in Blaze was wearing gloves and one person who came in from the back kept putting their mask on and off near the food. 

I used to come here all the time during the school year, but today, I just had such a terrible experience. The man making our pizza made a snarky remark when I asked him for a onions and was quite hostile when I was confused about placing the card in the container instead of handing it to him during the transaction. 

Blaze needs to get their act together or they can easily get shut down due to these conditions and the behavior their employees have towards their customers.

Very grateful for blaze pizza to be open during this time. The workers wore their mask during work, and every time they made a new pizza, they wore a different glove to ensure there is no contamination. I felt very welcomed and comfortable here and the portions they give for the pizza toppings were very generous. Overall, thankful and would come back!

source.name: Live Oak Cafe
source.categories: Farmers Market, Food, Fast Food, American (New), Bars, Wine Bars, Breakfast & Brunch, Cafes, Restaurants, Nightlife

review_info.review_text:
We had an excellent breakfast today at the Live Oak Cafe. My eggs and my wife's omelet were done just right. The coffee was hot & fresh. I should have thought to ask the brand name of the coffee because it was delicious.
Our server was also very good and the food was delivered to our table hot, which in some restaurants is a challenge.
This restaurant is very convenient to Cottage Hospital, the Sansum Clinic and other surrounding medical offices.
I highly recommend giving The Live Oak Cafe a try.

Absolutely loved my breakfast. I got a skillet with eggs, kale/spinach/quinoa side and it was oh so tasty. My best friend and I were on the way to the Santa Barbara Mission from LA and we left really early thinking there would be a ton of traffic. Much to our surprise, it wasn't that bad so we decided to stop by and grab a bite to eat. The location is real easy to pass by, but there was plenty of parking, and no one was there which was nice. I definitely want to stop by again because the food was healthy, tasty, and fresh!

What a surprising treat! Came here for lunch to get quality food and avoid crowds. The atmosphere is quiet, comfy and green. The service was great and oh the FRIED RICE! It's delicious with their in house cured bacon. Highly recommend. The pork buns were a special treat to find and very good. The bacon waffle was delicious as well, made with high quality ingredients. It was a great experience.

review_info.review_text: I love this place I do but when I walked in and saw fly's on the donuts I was devastated. Why!!!???

I'm sorry i hate to do this. But I just bough 6 donuts here today that were so stale and dried out. I threw.all but 1 away.   The chocolate old fashioned was so dry I couldn't even get thru one bite.   I get that there is so much less traffic.   But then make less at a time and make them again in the afternoon.   The maple  buttermilk bar weighed a ton and again was so dry.  Usually the apple fritter can save the day... but no go, unfortunately.  Of the six I bought the only one I was able to eat was the chocolate crueller.

I will say the girl who helped me was very friendly and was wearing a mask and washed her hands. So at least there's that!
The donuts were okay and the store was not the cleanest. The customer service was good nothing special but it wasn't bad customer service. But overall it was a okay experience

source.name: The Ritz-Carlton Bacara, Santa Barbara
source.categories: Restaurants, Beauty & Spas, American (New), Event Planning & Services, Hotels, Massage, Resorts, Day Spas, Hotels & Travel, Venues & Event Spaces

review_info.review_text: Beautiful setting. Nice addition to the chain. Great service by Jon! Food was good. And the ambiance was nice too.

Only a solid THREE STARS. 

I will put in details for my review here. This review is not biased, pure 100%  our experience staying at Ritz Carlton Bacara Santa Barbara. 

Ritz Carlton SB is not located in a prime area. This is a resort,  their property is isolated away from downtown so that customers can enjoy the activities that the resort provides, such as hiking by the beach, biking around the hotel area. Mind you, this hotel is not walkable to restaurants in SB, they provided their own chain restaurants to make guests enjoy and relax at the property.

Here is our experience:
Like any other experienced travellers, we booked our hotels through credit card partners using our mileage. Who pay their hotel rooms in full nowadays anyways? Most smart people pay their hotel rooms with points or mileage affiliated with credit cards company. Originally we booked for double beds. However a day before, I received an email from them that my room was changed to single bed. This is quite impossible to our situation since we have 2 adults and 2 children. So I called (many times) to our credit card company and to Ritz to make sure we would get 2 double beds instead of 1 single king bed. The number of phone calls to change the number of beds did not happen only in one call, unfortunately. I had to call them several times before our arrival. 

So, arrival day, we got our 2 double beds. Perfect. Checking in was a smooth process. The receptionist was polite, explaining us everything about the resort. By the way, the resort has so many activities that you could book first through their website. And I also appreciate the concierge emailed us days before reminding us about the activities on the days we stay. (Tips: the receptionist offered us a transportation like a luggage cart to transport the guests to your villas, ACCEPT IT! Ritz carlton property is so huge that you can even get lost in the area. You can walk if you want to reach your 10k steps, though). 

When we got to our hotel, problem arise. Tv did not work. I called the receptionist, and the technician came after an hour later. They tried their best to fix tv, unfortunately the problem was much bigger than they expected. The sad part was they KNEW the tv was broken already and Ritz didn't even solve the problem. (Technician told me our previous guest also had the same problem - broken tv). So, me just being me, asking for a compensation for the broken tv. The technician was very generous giving us $100 restaurant fee.  And I took it with my grateful heart. 

Resort wise; this property again has a lot activities that you can do with your kids, partners, etc. Hiking by the beach is the most popular activities done by my people. Biking around the area also a great thing to do. 

During check out time, there was a bit problem since I wanted to redeem the $100 certificate that the technician gave me. A bit miscommunication happened at that time, but they resolved it quickly.

Would I recommend you guys to stay here? if you have $1000 extra to spare for staying a night here, sure you should. 
Don't forget to add
Parking vallet is $53 a day
Resort fee is $50 a day. (that's why maximise the property since you're charged hefty for resort fee). 

Other than that, yes I would stay again here. Hopefully I can bump this review to 4 star next time.

Amazing hotel with such such comfy rooms. We had a iv and there was an area right outside the room where he could go in the morning..so so convenient..there was a small lawn with a gorgeous fountain right outside the room which was awesome. The GYM WAS BEYOND FANTASTIC!!! the views were great. Service was great at the coffee shop and the bar. Room service we got it in the lobby was great. THE YUCCA FRIES ARE A MUST Have!!! The chips and guacamole were totally yum! We got takeout in the lobby and hung out which was so fun! Having a fridge and microwave in the room was so helpful. We will definitely come back. Highly recommend!

source.categories: Food, Cafes, Coffee & Tea, Bakeries, Restaurants

review_info.review_text:
A friend got me interested in this coffee shop when she mentioned they sell vegan cookies. I'm vegan, and it's actually rather tough to find vegan sweet snacks in IV, so I was excited to try Campus Point. Funnily enough, when I headed over for a studying session, they were sold out! Guess those cookies must be good. 

However, the coconut charcoal mocha I tried was delicious--and vegan! Staff were super friendly, and I appreciated the indoor and outdoor seating options. Also, there's a toilet, which is a bonus, and the empanadas looked really yummy. I'll have to try one next time I visit.

Finally a place in Isla Vista with a bathroom!

Beyond the much needed bathroom this cafe offers a plethora of interesting drinks on top of providing all the basics. I got an iced charcoal mocha that was perfect to get rid of my mid afternoon slump.

This is such a cute lil coffee shop in the heart of IV. There's tables inside and outside to do work or chill, and sometimes there's an open mic outside. Prices are average for your local non-corporate coffee shop. The menu has a wide variety of drinks, and sometimes they post about BOGO's or 50% off on their instagram page. I'd definitely recommend this place to anyone who loves coffee and needs a place to study!

Customers find the staff friendly and the cafe's atmosphere conducive for studying. It's also noted for its provision of bathroom facilities. Campus Point Coffee regularly posts special offers and discounts on their social media platforms. However, there is no parking available at the premises. However, they enjoyed the delicious coconut charcoal mocha, which is also vegan. The staff was friendly, and the indoor and outdoor seating options were appreciated. Additionally, the presence of a bathroom was seen as a bonus.

source.name: Mr B Restaurant & Cafe
source.categories: Food, Restaurants, Middle Eastern, Cafes, Bakeries

review_info.review_text: One of the best restaurants and Mediterranean food I've ever had!! They are very clean and the employees there are very nice and good energy as well as the owner.. I'm definitely going back. DEFINITELY RECOMMEND!!

Honestly i cant describe this place. It is one of my favorite stops in SB. The shawarma Sandwich taste sooo good and the hummus is the best. Alo the fried chicken was something else. Crispy and Halal. The staff are so friendly and the vibes are super. Will definitely come back. This place is super awesome.

We were excited to try this place out, but we're extremely disappointed. The service was slow, it seemed like there were only two people working. The silverware was not very clean. The ambiance was awkward, very quiet, like a doctors office lobby. The beef schwarma sandwich was not good at all. The meat had no flavor, couldn't taste any seasonings. It was also wrapped in a tortilla. A tortilla??! While the menu says "flat bread." I was hoping that at least the baklava would be good, but it was so dry. The hummus that came with the schwarma wasn't that great, either. The Turkish coffee was decent though. Would not recommend and will not come back. 1 star for being ambitious enough to open a new restaurant in town.

review_info.review_text: Half and half beef ribs and pork FTW.  Best I've *ever* had, and I've had a lot of good Korean food.

So. Good. So good. A Kogilicious spicy chicken burrito is one of my favorite foods in the world. But all of the proteins are fantastic- beef, spicy pork, tofu; can't go wrong. Taco, burrito, both are great. And so reasonably priced! Pay cash; you'll get a giant burrito for less than $7, which is unheard of elsewhere in IV. This town desperately needs a proper Korean restaurant, but in the meantime, Kogilicious hits the spot.

Three words, Spicy Pork Burrito.

Bomb.

Bring cash, they charge more if you use a card.

source.name: Dargan's Irish Pub & Restaurant
source.categories: Restaurants, Bars, Irish, Nightlife, Pubs, Gastropubs

review_info.review_text:
Fun spot with multiple pool tables in the back. 

If you're local this is one of the spots where you will probably know most of the people inside on a busy Friday or Saturday night. 

Patty in the front is awesome as always.

We brought my mother-in-law for lunch.  She is English and we were relieved that she enjoyed the food.  The food was hearty and we were very full.  It's a very spacious and clean pub.  They also had outdoor dining.  We had very good service.

Finally, an Irish pub that can actually pour a proper pint of Guinness in southern California.  It is nice to see they actually have a legit nitro system, comparable to the ones from Ireland.  

This is a good place to grab a bite away from the hustle and bustle of state street.  There were plenty of available tables and no wait for dinner. 
This fish and chips were solid along with the steak pie.  Also had chicken tenders off the kids menu and my daughter had no complaints. 

4 stars.

review_info.review_text: We pre ordered our thanksgiving dinner. They ran over an hour late with our meal and ran out of stuffing. WTF... how do u run out of stuffing!!! I will never ever support this business!! Thank you for ruining our thanksgiving. Still waiting two hours laters... stop telling us 15 more minutes every time.

So glad to have discovered Uncorked!  Each meal we have ordered  for pick up has been fantastic,   with generous size portions and ready for our timed pickup.  Last night the prime rib was one of the best I have ever had with a delicious sauce, mashed potatoes, veggie salad and desert.

We have ordered take out from Uncorked many times over the last year - probably more than anywhere else. Every time we are thrilled with what we order. This most recent time we ordered the salmon wellington and beef wellington and were impressed by how tasty the puff pastry was, especially after traveling from the restaurant to our house. We'll be back often!

source.name: Neighbor Tim's BBQ
source.categories: Food Trucks, Barbeque, Restaurants, Food Delivery Services, Food, American (New)

review_info.review_text:
I had been wanting to try Neighbor Tim's BBQ since I heard about it several months ago. Tonight was finally the night we were going to order it! I ordered through GrubHub - I got the 2 meats/1 side deal with 2 orders of brisket, Mac and cheese, and added a side of the potato salad with bacon, and the beans with bacon. That also comes with white bread, pickles, and their "famous BBQ sauce". Overall, it was a little pricey but IF it's good I am willing to pay it. 

So, I am really bummed out to report that I was really disappointed by the food. I wanted to like it so much I thought for sure this would be my new go-to BBQ place! But, one of the biggest things was they didn't give me any of their "famous BBQ sauce" and that's really what felt like was missing from the brisket. 

The sides were ok. I thought the Mac and cheese was a little dry/bland but with a little salt and pepper on it, it helped. I thought the potato salad with bacon was pretty good but needed something acidic to break down all the starchiness. The beans with bacon was good - probably my favorite side of the 3.
I'd be willing to give it another try in the future WITH their BBQ sauce though, so don't totally count me out!

Loved our family feast! Thank you for bringing the joy of smoked meats and carefully crafted sides to our Saturday night. Awesome brisket and mac and cheese. Glad we decided to make the last minute addition of corn and black bean salad. Amazing customer service.  Thank you Tim's crew! We'll be ordering again.

One of the good things about having grown up nephews and nieces: people of whom i have had a good amount of contact and influence on when they were growing up: adults now who drive, think, analyze, care about you (as in me) is that i can ask them to drive me somewhere, get me something at various and sundry places and as in last week: order, pay for and pick up a meal. To be fair i warned them when they were kids: your uncle is going to expect to be paid back for all the driving, picking up, leaving off, etc., etc., i did for you. So NOW is that time.
But for now i am relishing the well earned attention. And i'm only 1/2 kidding here in any event.
Several weeks ago my niece told me about Neighbor Tim's both as a food truck and a stand alone BBQ joint.
I zipped into SB and asked her to bring some BBQ for me, her kids and hubby as well as for my sisters. She raved about this place. So i thought: ok, sounds good: so bring me some, please.
Well bring me some she did:
Pork ribs
Brisket
Potato Salad
Mac and cheese
White Bread thick sliced
Sauce: Amazing Sauce it is called
Burnt Ends (from another time but reviewed here)
The ribs were perfectly cooked and meaty. I am a purist when it comes to ribs. they must be tender and juicy but not falling off the bone meaning i pick one up and the meat falls off. That is too well cooked, usually cooked with too much moisture and not enough heat or smoke.
These ribs though were well smoked, well seasoned (not too salty) and were delivered w/o sauce which is the way i prefer them so that you can taste the meat and not just the sauce. The sauce btw is super also: vinegary, light on the sugars with a snappy chili finish: north carolina style which surprised me only because i thought this was a Texas style BBQ joint. But it works so why fight it. 
The Brisket was also well seasoned and smoked as well as very moist and tender. No knife needed to cut and we made sammys using the white bread and dipping in the sauce to finish.
The Mac and cheese is nothing special: just cheese sauce and noodles. This needed salt and pepper for starters. 
The potato salad was a big letdown also: the dressing was good and in the right proportion: neither too much or not enough but again salt and pepper would have helped and acid is needed desperately. Pickles, mustard, maybe or both?  Also most damning is that the potatoes were slightly undercooked. in other words too al dente for my taste. 
Thick white bread was in the Texas toast style and it was real tasty: reminded me of a traditional pullman loaf. Yeasty, high quality bread not Wonder Bread, remember?
The burnt ends were not part of this order but we had these about 4 weeks ago and they were absolutely first rate: charred, and well seasoned to within an inch of their lives. Tim's are made from the deckle of the brisket i am going to assume and are super tasty chunks of beefy goodness. Next day you can thinly slice and use in a taco or sammy or just to pop in your mouth while pretending to grab a beer from the refer.
All in all a very good sampling today of Neighbor Tim's wares:  what they do well they do very, very well. I will be back!

source.name: California Wood-Fired Catering
source.categories: Food Trucks, Event Planning & Services, Pizza, Restaurants, Caterers, Food

review_info.review_text:
We had them provide pizza for about 100 folks at Municipal Wine. Food was great -- salad, pizza, and gelato. All great. 

They warned us that it would be hard to get pizzas out for that large a crowd, and they were right. But they did the best they could in the situation and everyone was happy. Their chefs worked hard to please and did a great job. 

Only negatives were: underestimated salad, so we ran out a little early. And Email response was a little slow. That said, a pleasure to work with and tasty food!

California Wood-Fired Catering is delicious and perfect for a casual, fun event! I have had the pleasure of working with them many times for events at the private event venue that I manage. While I have heard from a few clients that the owner can be sometimes difficult to get a hold of, I myself have never had a problem reaching him by calling the number listed on their website. Either way they always come through with the events that they book and the guests always rave about how fun it is having a wood-fired burning oven popping out fresh pizzas as well as how delicious the food is.

This year for 4th of July we checked out the Stow House old fashioned 4th of July:) What a pleasant surprise. We were lucky enough to stumble on these pizza people who were making pizza in special oven:) it was really good and hope they can come to our school carnivals next year:)

source.name: Sushi Ai
source.categories: Sushi Bars, Restaurants, Japanese

review_info.review_text:
Whenever I order at Sushi Ai
The entire staff is polite, and accommodating. The restaurant is very clean. I
Have been a customer since they opened... 
Now that there are deliveries
This restaurant, and doordash do a great job. The sushi, and tempura, and soups...everything so fresh So Good. Thank you Sushi Ai, especially Leanna P. S.
Sauces Teri, eel, spicy mayo!
Yum yum

Oye my fiance and I went here today for the first and last time.
I felt bad for the girls trying to run the dinner rush because they were so overwhelmed. There was only two people in front.
We ordered two bento boxes and edamame. We got the boxes fast but my fiances was wrong. The girl took it back without giving me any utensils. We finally got my utensils and his food and she walked away without giving him utensils.
We also purchased edamame, reminded the girl and still never got it. (We did get a refund for that).
But while I was waiting for 10 minutes for the refund, 1 person came up to say 3 things were missing for their order and another woman came up saying her teriyaki was cold. There was also a ridiculous amount of togo orders that they were super behind on.

The manager/ owner needs to pay more people to work. I dont know if someone just called out or they are extremely under staffed but be careful coming here on a rush.

My sushi was served hot...I think that's enough said.

I ordered the dynamite roll and it just wasn't good. I understand this is americanized sushi but the scallops were overcooked and it was covered in a heavy layer of spicy mayo. For $15, it's really not worth it. Spend your money elsewhere.

source.name: Minnow Cafe
source.categories: Restaurants, Delis

review_info.review_text:
This place is perfect to get some seafood in Santa Barbara! I was glad to be able to find this hole in a wall while walking with my group for lunch. 

I ordered the clam chowder bread bowl and fish and chips. Clam chowder was very delicious and fresh. The fish was crispy and made into perfection. 

The best part is that you can order the food right away and simply sit at the tables outside to eat near the harbor where the ocean is so close. So if you want to get food in a quickly manner in order to have more time to explore the other areas in Santa Barbara, I would highly recommend Minnow Cafe.
Hard to beat for a fast-food-type breakfast or lunch at the marina. Simple, good food, well prepared.

I really like the Minnow...I mean you can't beat the location for a fast food establishment and the Fish Tacos are pretty good...BUT I'm always horrified to discover how much this fast food experience costs.  I mean, it's really not very good food unless you view it as cheap (but it's not).  Great thing, sitting outside by the harbor watching the BPs go by while you eat cheap (seeming) food.  Bad part, greasy spoon food served on paper plates by snarky staff with condiments that blow away...but it ain't cheap.  Guess that's Santa Barbara.

responses.response: Minnow Cafe, located at 9 Breakwater in Santa Barbara, CA, is a casual eatery categorized under Restaurants and Delis. It boasts a 4-star rating for its services. The reviews highlight its prime location near the harbor, perfect for enjoying their fresh seafood offerings, including praised dishes like clam chowder and fish and chips. Also noted is the convenience of its fast-food setup, which allows customers to order and enjoy their meals quickly, ideal for those exploring the city. However, some reviews indicate that the food might be seen as expensive for a fast-food experience and mention a slightly less satisfactory customer service. The cafe offers outdoor seating and take-out services, but does not offer WiFi, music, or reservations. It also lacks business parking except for a lot.

review_info.review_text: Was such a special evening on the whisper cruise! Could not recommend more - amazing deal for an hour and a half watching dolphins as the sun sets. The captain is great too,  making sure you see everything you want to see !
Ride is very smooth , fair prices, nice crew, they even take pictures of your group,located on the pier..

The service with celebration cruises is amazing. Yesterday I brought my mom out for a birthday cruise on whisper. Kathy was incredibly helpful and accommodating when I made the reservation. This company is full of heart. On the day of the cruise captain Mike had a lot of interesting information to share with us about Santa Barbara and the marine life we spotted while we were out on the water. We even got to see dolphins which was icing on the cake. It was a very special day and I can't thank you all enough. I highly recommend coming out with them on any of their boats.

source.name: Santa Barbara Bay Cafe
source.categories: Seafood, Restaurants

review_info.review_text:
Awesome spot to grab a bite to eat. This place is legit for the mere fact that it is very unassuming. We chose this spot because it was a market/restaurant. From my experience fish is best cooked and prepared by those who are in the market of selling it. I ordered the swordfish along with a pint of Central Calfornia's Finest Firestone Ale.   
I would recommend this to anyone who wants to relax and indulge in great seafood.

This was our lunch stop during the Captain Jack's winery tour.  It was fairly disappointing even though we kept our choices simple.  I had a cup of clam chowder and a serving of the oysters Rockefeller.  The clam chowder was off in its flavors.  It was a touch more watery than I would have liked.  I also did not come away with a nice rich, buttery flavor; this offering was much less nuanced, pedestrian in nature.  Clam was seldom seen throughout.  The oysters were definitely a miss.  These were not the famous ones from Antoine's.  The variation here was a very thick layer of melted cheese spiked with spinach or was that chives?  I couldn't tell, because the only thing I could taste was cheese.  It even dominated the natural taste of the ocean in the oysters entirely which really misses the point of the dish.  It is called Rockefeller because it is a very rich dish.  This was clunky.  Worse, one could simply scrape off the layer of coagulated cheese and just eat the oyster.  There was no melding of flavors, no subtleness to it at all.   A better name for this dish would have been oysters Velveeta.  Pass.
We are Santa Barbara locals.  I think they have the best seafood in town.  Don't over look the specials they offer.    I have tried them and they are fantastic!

source.name: Le Cafe Stella
source.categories: Restaurants, American (New), French

review_info.review_text: Really cute restaurant, nice servers, and pretty good French food. Classic French cuisine - French onion soup and frogs legs. Prices are surprisingly reasonable. I was pretty disappointed by the wines by the glass but the cocktails were good.

Thanks to Executive Chef Roth Ironside and his entire team for bringing "A Local Taste of France" to all of us here in Santa Barbara. 

We've usually enjoyed their dining room area, but this time had the pleasure of sitting, eating and drinking at the Bar. So much fun to be there up close and personal with the Bartender Amber as she created very special cocktails, and also made some spot-on food suggestions. Her depth of knowledge in both the world of spirits and food was much appreciated.

Their Bar Menu/Petit Plats offers a wide array of dishes, and we started right away with the Pate de Campagne, and Oeufs Mimosa. Both incredibly delicious, and with so much happening on those plates. 

For our Plats Principaux/Specialitees, we enjoyed the Chicken Cordon Bleu, and Fettucchini Alfredo Au Poulet. Both very aromatic and tasty.

It was truly a special night of good food and drink, and fun conversations, and I am excited to share this dining experience with family and friends.
One of my favorite restaurants! Overall wonderful experience and will definitely be coming back. Definitely a spot for locals and to enjoy when visiting Santa Barbara.

review_info.review_text: I had a great experience at this Panera. I first observed how polite and respectful the employees were to the outdoor guest & the curbside/socially distant pickups, which stood out to me. I, then was cordially greeted by Wyatt. He embraced me and made sure all my questions were answered. I loved how patient Wyatt. I got the PICK 2 and my order was perfect. I am so grateful Wyatt made my experience exceptional. Thank you.

If you want uncooked food and the food you didn't even order then this place would be great for that. Our food came cold, it was wrong, and there was missing things. Honestly this place is not it. Go spend your money where you'll actually get good bang for you buck.

The worst lunch I've had...

If you wanna waste your time, money, and joy, come visit Panera Bread in Santa Barbara. We are experts at getting your order wrong, running out of the only thing we have going for us (bread bowls), and giving you a bad attitude as you try and sort it out. Worry not -- our food will come icy cold no matter if it's Mac and cheese or soup! 

Looking for work? Our poor management is eagerly anticipating giving you poor training, and little help as you enter this low level job. We will show you how to treat customers poorly and give them less attention than a mean high school girl to a nerd in computer science class. Come serve our community with low efforts, and even less cares.

Sincerely, 
Panera bread

source.name: Domingo's Cafe
source.categories: Breakfast & Brunch, Restaurants, Mexican, American (Traditional)

review_info.review_text: I love local places and this is it! Home style feel and nice little breakfast cafe.  Breakfast burritos are on point! Maybe one of the best in town with crispy hash browns, eggs cooked just right, and the perfect amount of cheese! I like to get the spicy salsa to top it off.

What a friendly morning breakfast spot chock full of locals with their families. Seating is available both inside and out. My bacon avocado cheese omelet was very good. The fresh mellon berry cup I asked for on the side was so full of fresh fruit flavor. The toasted sour dough bread was wonderfully crusty and lightly buttered, however it came to me cold. 
My companion asked for the salsa verde with his meal. Be careful. It's very picante!
Apple Pay is taken. I used the restroom and found the toilet actively leaking. Apparently, it's an ongoing issue.  
All in all, there were a few issues, but no deal breakers here. Enjoy!

Everyone enjoyed brunch.  Sons had the pancake special. Wife had the mash substituted sausage for ground beef.  And I had tuna melt with grilled onions.   Next time we are in Santa Barbara we will return

review_info.review_text: Please make your restaurants and drink shops go straw less!! So many straws and you are on the ocean! Help the sea animals! Zoos are straw less for the animals. Be straw less for the sea animals!! Please help save the Ocean life!! To all the people that come to these places, say no to straws ahead of time. Bring you're own reusable cups with reusable straws. Have the shops give a discount for those that bring their own reusable straws and cups/bottles. One step at a time and we can do it.

People come to SB for the beach, here you go! 

Decent sized pier to walk on and watch the fishermen and rowers.  A few shops and restaurants are at the end of the pier and they have some parking with a cost. It's really not that awesome but if you come to CA to see the beaches you should walk atleast one beach pier.

Ive spent too much time here.The dockage fees are insane.The staff is great but thier hands are tied with crazy policies.The place is crawling with snobs that wont give you the time of day unless you have lots of money.Great place for people watching I guess.

source.name: Peebee & Jays
source.categories: Sandwiches, Restaurants

review_info.review_text: Their sandwiches are fantastic, but don't opt for the cauliflower flatbread. They pack so much into these sandwiches that the flatbread can't handle it, so you're paying extra for a flimsier sandwich. I've also had trouble getting all my points for my weekly purchases. Their system is confusing, and they were unresponsive after multiple attempts to fix it. That said, their sandwiches are all great. Go for soft rolls with the Bacon Went on a Date and add turkey. So good.

I got a lot pb with honey and a Nutella pb with marshmallow fluff they were pretty good the only real issue I had was that the crust was rubbery and hard to but into but over all it was super delicious

I will never go back to this location again. The workers in general have a negative attitude and think the customers owe them a medal for showing up to work. I placed a pick up order and put on the special instructions for the Mayo and Mustard to be on the side. Well, I got my sandwich and it was drenched in Mayo, something I wanted to avoid. I called them and the employee told me they could remake it. I threw the sandwich away and about 15 mins later got a call and was told that I had to bring the sandwich back. I told them I already tossed it in the garbage then the employee put his manager on the line and she was so RUDE and said that I need to bring it back ( I wasn't about to dig through the trash) and I said that the employee never said anything about bringing the sandwich back in the first conversation and he should have said something and expect me to still have it. And she said very unprofessionally, "well he didn't know." I told her that is a failure on the training and not the customer. She then said that next time I need to specifically write the word "everything" on the side instead of using commas as I did. This manager is absolutely disgusting and clearly has no basic customer service skills. 

This isn't the first time my pick up order has been destroyed. But the way that "manager" spoke to me and handledis why I will NEVER go there again and will tell all my coworkers to stay away. 

To the owner of this location: good Managers are hard to come by but you can absolutely do better then who was working on 10/13/21 @ 12:30 pm. She is horrible at her job and will continue to drive away customers with her terrible attitude.

source.name: Soho Restaurant & Music Club
source.categories: Music Venues, Bars, Nightlife, Arts & Entertainment, Restaurants, American (Traditional)

review_info.review_text: called us idiots. we're extremely rude and racist. went to have a good time but clearly i didn't.

I tested positive for COVID (despite being vaccinated and boosted) and even though I am feeling fine, I made the responsible decision to not attend a show at Soho I had purchased tickets to in advance.  

Unfortunately, their no refund policy encourages people who have tested positive to attend shows anyway, increasing the chance of spreading COVID, when cases are currently surging in Santa Barbara County with the highly contagious omicron variant.

I understand that a no refund policy for event tickets may be standard in normal circumstances, but many, if not all, concert venues in town have adapted flexible and generous refund/exchange policies for obvious reasons in the current climate.

Bottom Line:  The best live music venue in Santa Barbara, without question.  I think we are in House of Blues territory now!

Toe's Tavern, The Hibar, Yukitan, The Coach House, The history of Santa Barbara music venues is nearly as colorful as the history of the bands that came out of this town; Toad the Wet Sproket, Dishwalla, Big Bad Voodoo Daddy, The Ataris, Lagwagon, No Use for a Name, Snot, Nerf Herder......the SBCC Lunch Break band.

Nearly every single live music venue is gone from the golden era of music in this town.  Back in the 1990's I used to be on the local 'sound guys' that would turn up and try and make sure people could hear the bands.

Soho was absolutely one of the places where I used to do sound and sit against the wall behind what was basically a TV tray with a Mackie 1604 on it for $40 a night plus free drinks.  It was dark and kind of dingy but thats what they were all like back in the world of analog.

How times have changed in 20+ years (which is essentially the amount of time its been since i have been to Soho).

Ive heard people talk about it recently but never put much thought into it as I used to work there - still had the idea of a dark, hole in the wall type place in my brain.

Well, last night the wife tells me that we have a date night.  Sweet!   It had been some time since we had been able to get out together.  I didnt know that local hero Chris Schiflett was going to be playing so having dinner with the wife was going to be icing on the cake for sure.

We had the hamburger and the raviolis both of which were great.  The burger was excellent which frankly is really saying something with the burger game being what it is these days.  Tender, moist, lots of flavor - steak fries done properly which is a little crispy and not doughy and hot enough to burn my mouth!   Yes!!
The raviolis are very similar to the ones I have had at Ca'Dario and were excellent.

Over drinks we had a Creme Brule as well and that was also delicious.

Into the room for the show and do you know how you can tell how the sound is pretty good?  When you dont notice it.

While getting my audio engineering degree years ago, I realized that the best sound people are ones that you never notice.  Which is kind of sad but it absolutely true - Ive always said that a good sound are like good windshield wipers: if they are doing their job properly, you'll never know they are there.

Half way through the show, I realized that I had just been enjoying the show and not critiquing how it sounded and it hit me - thats because the sound was good!  How refreshing and thank you kind engineer, whomever you are.


I was properly blown away last night at our visit to Soho.  Food was great, the venue is great, the staff are helpful, the bathrooms are modern and functional, the sound was great....  I may not have even recognized it had I been teleported - they have done an incredible job right down to the super modern and very fancy bathrooms.

Ill be back here just for dinner - not even for a show but I will absolutely be back for both. 

Well done, Soho!  You're keeping the local music scene alive

review_info.review_text: Stopped in for a quick lunch here. Interior atmosphere is run-of-the-mill, but window tables have great views of the pier and waterfront. Ordered crab cakes for app and thought they were excellent. Ordered ahi salad with the mango relish for main and was expecting the usual light ahi tuna salad, but it was big (I did ordered extra tuna, was worth it) and had SO many flavors that mixed really well together without tasting over-seasoned. Loved it. Well priced too.

Die Auswahl auf der Karte, das Essen selbst, Service und Ambiente waren allesamt gut.

Can't wait to come back.

review_info.review_text: The Oysters were fascinating, and the place itself was fantastic too! Myself, is a Oyster's lover, and this place has proved it. The Oysters are very fresh and tasty too, will recommend it to any people that are a big fan of Oysters or seafood. 5-star rating from me to this place.

I took my granddaughter here today & deeply regret it.  At the first bite I should have refused it and moved on but I didn't want to upset my granddaughter who was hungry.  We both had fish & chips.  The fish was so bad that I asked the waiter what kind it was.  He said " it's red snapper, does it taste funky ?"  I'd like the restaurant to prove that wasn't the lowest quality tilapia on the market.  It tasted like metal and mud. The manager & owner should take some home to their families & see the reaction. It's vile.  The whole place is run down & I should have left immediately.

Thanksgiving dinner was awful. Service was discriminatory and catered to others much more. Was given plastic cutlery and nobody even gave us menus. 
Had to get my own menu, find a server and nobody told us about any specials. 
Absolutely ruined my day and would request you to go somewhere else unless you like to be disappointed.

source.name: Killer B's BBQ Bar and Grill
source.categories: Sports Bars, Bars, Barbeque, Nightlife, Restaurants

review_info.review_text: This place really made my hemorrhoids flare up. The food came pretty quickly but unfortunately for me it wreaked havoc on my stomach. Within one hour of finishing my food I found myself sitting on a public toilet in downtown Santa Blahblah between a movie theater and a Marshells. The porcelain toilet shone in the way that only a toilet used by countless homeless men, as not only a receptacle for their excrement but also a handy place to nap, could shine. That being said when I left that not so holy of throne rooms it was stained with with the dark blood of man who hasn't been comfortable on a toilet for far too long.

My fiancee and I frequented Killer B's at their State street location, and I would have given it a 3.5 star at that time.  It was always so-so. A good place to grab a quick drink, or a quick bite when you want something quick and easy, nothing fancy.  The servers were always rather annoying and not very friendly or quick, and they always spent more time talking to each other than to their tables. 

We finally decided to try out the new Killer B location with the intent of using our Axxess card there, and we left without even ordering food.  

We sat at a table inside, and was greeted by the bartender who was EXTREMELY rude and unfriendly.  He literally walked away from me mid sentence. He tried everything possible to avoid eye contact, and he had absolutely not hustle in his step. That however wasn't even the last straw.  We went ahead and ordered two drinks, a beer for me and a cosmopolitan for the lady. the cosmo was GROSS! I honestly think that he forgot to put he alcohol in the drink.  It was watered down and tasteless.  

Bad service, bad drinks... we decided not to continue and order what we can only assume would be bad food. 

Will never be returning here by my own decision.  Too many other good restaurants to waste time on this place.  We walked over the Santa Barbara Brew and enjoyed a delicious dinner and drinks that actually had alcohol in them.

Such a shame!

This review is not based on the food at this establishment, rather on the lack of service and attention.

I was in Santa Barbara for the day on the weekend of Cinco de Mayo. It was a Sunday around 2pm and I had been looking for a place to eat when I searched for a BBQ joint nearby.

When I got to the place I walked into the courtyard where a band was setting up and a few people were gathered.

As I walked into the place there was a sign that read something like please wait to be seated.

The girl behind the bar was talking with some other girl and when I asked whether I could sit anywhere there was no response, not even a glance.

The possible owner of the place (An older leathery looking fellow) walked in and ushered a server outside to do something and again, no attention to the new walk in what so ever.

Finally I asked the guy behind the line what's going on and he finally told me that they are offering a Cinco de Mayo menu and no BBQ in sight.

So... this place get a 1 star from me and a promise that I will NEVER come back again!

When I worked in the restaurant business back in NYC there was NO SUCH THING as letting a walk in just stand there unattended within 30 seconds or less. At least acknowledge the person and let them feel like you gave a S!

I had high hopes for this place... alas!

source.name: Denny's
source.categories: Restaurants, Diners, Breakfast & Brunch, American (Traditional)

review_info.review_text: I was shocked by the level of exceptional service I received here. My waiter, Gabriel I believe it was, catered to my needs above and beyond from what I expected at Denny's and treated me like a long time friend.

This was the ONLY 24 hour restaurant in the area. It was affordable and the seating was very comfortable. Evidently, the franchise owner sold it, and it is now closing. This is a huge loss to this entire community, as this was a truly comfortable place for regular folks, families and students to go and eat...and it was almost always packed to the rafters.

The word is that the landlord jacked the rent up to over 20k per month, triple net, and that was unsustainable for the owner, so he sold up and left.

How many fussy, trendy, hispter places must there be? I guess these are the only type of businesses welcome in southern Santa Barbara County.

So glad I left there when I did!

RIP Denny's Goleta :-(
Good luck trying to call them while they're open...which is 24 hours apparently. Called 4 times, and no one picked up even though it was clearly open. Good stuff.

source.categories: Restaurants, Thai

review_info.review_text: Went in for lunch and felt like I'd gone back in time. Service was lousy. The place was dark. An upgrade is sorely needed. Few customers. And you couldn't smell anything cooking despite the noise from the kitchen. Waited for server so I left!
Food poisoning. Ordered the spicy fried rice and it tasted bad, spicy in areas badly seasoned and food poisoning to follow. HORRIBLE.

As you can tell, I am a big fan of Pad Thai lol. This time is a Pad Thai from Pattaya Thai, and despite the chicken and shrimp being cooked very well and not overcooked, I unfortunately found this Pad Thai to be a bit bland. Now I have high standards for Pad Thai, but I know Pattaya is able to deliver better results. The flavors were all there, but with Pad Thai it is easy for there to be not enough flavor, which makes the dish taste terrible. This was alright.

Averaged from my last review, this is 4 stars.

review_info.review_text: I wish they would update their hours at Panda Express.On Yelp they have the store closing at 9:30 pm but the employee said they close at 8 pm. Also,the exterior business sign is dark so even when they are  open it looks like they are closed.

I came here today for some good comfort food in the lonely dark ages of isla vista. Instead what I got was some sick, demented kind of prank that turned the land of gumdrop rainforests and chocolate rivers into my worst nightmare. 
I walk in 30 minute line, which is not their fault.
What is their fault is my cream cheese rangoons with no fucking cream cheese in them. I pay a premium for a warm fluffy dollop of cream cheese encapsulated in a crispy puff pastry but what I get is a lukewarm soggy fried ball sack with nothing but a wisp of the creamy cheese that belongs there. This is not ok.
One star for good vibes
Terrible service; line was out the door, very rude, not allergy accommodating. 1/5 for sure

source.name: O'Malleys Bar
source.categories: Nightlife, Bars, Sports Bars

review_info.review_text: This place is horrible! The bouncers were incredibly rude and saying disturbing things to me. I left the bar and had come back for them to give me a hard time about coming in again. I asked for their names and they responded "I don't have to tell you shit". Worst night of my life. I went home crying after the horrible stuff that was said to me.  I will never be coming here again or recommending this place to anyone. If you enjoy bouncers taking advantage of you and their job then this is the place to go. Sharkeez right next door was way more accommodating, if your looking for a safe bar with friendly people, I would recommended Sharkeez.

My son was a groomsman at a wedding in Santa Barbara on October 10, 2021, a Sunday night.  After the reception, around 11:30 pm, a couple of the guests went to O'Malleys for a drink.  My son's bar bill was $40 and he added a $15 tip.  O'Malleys' added $400 to his credit card for a total of a $455 charge.  This is FRAUD and THEFT.  I called OMalleys' numerous times, leaving a name and phone number since they don't answer their telephone - with no reply.  I am shocked and dismayed by this outright theft.  DO NOT PATRONIZE THIS BAR, their employees are dishonest and thieves.

I know, I know.... People might be shocked to see that O'Malley's gets a five star rating from me.   More on that later.  

O'Malley's is hard to categorize which I believe is the reason it is not carrying a higher Yelp rating.   I would describe it as a "neighborhood bar located at ground zero of tourist central".  Some would call it a dive bar, it isn't.   I am a bit of a dive bar connoisseur and O'Malley's falls short or more accurately elevates above the standard of dive bar.   Mostly for the lack of bar flys sitting at the counter at 11:00am.  

They have an amazing team, many who have worked here for years and are loved by SB locals.   Duane and Katie are fabulous and today as I write this Haley is working!   She just made me an amazing margarita.  

Now, why five stars? Because I come here so freakin' much.   How could I ever knock off a star for a place I frequent many times in a month.  SB falls short in the sports bar department and O'Malleys has TV's in abundance!  Inside, on the patio and now out front on State Street.   Whether you love football, Dodger games or European Soccer they have it on.   If you are visiting SB you might have noticed it is not uncommon to pay $16 for a drink, not O'Malley's, I don't know how many times I got my bill and said "we ordered five drinks" and heard them respond "yes, they are all on there".  As a tourist you might find O'Malley's to be a little unkept for the fancy SB vibe you are used to, but come back on your next visit, and then your next.   I'm sure you will embrace it as I do.
