source.name: South Coast Deli-Goleta
source.categories: Sandwiches, Restaurants, Delis

review_info.review_text: The TNA (turkey and avocado) panini is by far my favorite thing to order here but I have never been disappointed with anything else. All of the ingredients taste fresh and delicious! The portions are large (for me anyways) and I tend to eat one sandwich or salad for two meals. You can walk in and order or order online (which I highly recommended because it can get busy at lunch time). There is a wide variety of sandwiches, salads, beverages and chips to choose from. Check out the inside of the store for beverage and chip selections. Parking here isn't always easy due to the amount of customers but there are always people coming and going.

Despite doing your best during covid. There is just a lack of attention at this location. I asked for it toasted well... it's just barley toasted. They tell me they will bring it out to me. Dude behind the counter just let's it sit there. After about 25 minutes I go in guy is just standing there with my now cold sandwich behind him on the counter. HALF THE SANDWHICH DISNT EVEN HAVE THE BACON IT WAS SUPPOSED TO COME WITH.  He's got the attitude of I'm just here for the paycheck. ONCE AGAIN SCD PATTERSON. YOUVE LOST ME. source.name: La Casa De Maria
source.categories: Health Retreats, Venues & Event Spaces, Hotels & Travel, Restaurants, Event Planning & Services

review_info.review_text: I love this place. Would stay here forever, if I could. Accommodations are a little rustic, but that's part of the charm. Lovely place for self-discovery and contemplation.

What a beautiful place and relaxing atmosphere. The accommodations are fairly comfortable, but it's the grounds that make this gem of a place special. (The food doesn't hurt either.) Get a massage from Vesalina if at all possible; it was the best I've ever had. Also, be sure to check out the gardens and chapels.

i write this review for two reasons. 1) The welfare of future guests; 2) and because the issue has never been addressed by anyone at the facility since I packed my things, left a day before the end of my $piritual retreat, and proceeded to spend the very expensive day delousing everything I owned -- including detailing my car, fumigating/washing/drycleaning all my clothes that I didn't want to throw away -- before returning home to my girlfriend and the beautiful bed she bought a few months before..

Bedbugs. Repeat. Bedbugs, In my case, Room 12.  Infested. I slept in the shower stall the last night I was there because sadly this was not my first rodeo with bedbugs. Note: I am not thin-skinned when it comes to the outdoors. I have lived out of a tent for several summers in Alaska. I love hiking, camping, and grew up in a rural area in the midwest. In short, I am not spooked by a raccoon (or a bear for that matter) or run for cover if buzzed by a hornet. 

But bedbugs?   (yeeeych) 

Yes, those wonderful little traveling insects -- much like fleas -- that want to come home with you. The kind of bugs that bite and bite -- in my case, my neck and legs -- and seemingly can live beyond any pesticide or laundering. 

I would rather have mice running across my face than knowingly sleep in a bed(room) infested with bedbugs. 

To be fair, the young man working the desk the night I "captured" one of the well-sized creatures in a plastic cup was sympathetic and saw about getting me another room the next morning.  I was so itchy and disappointed that I had to deal with the after effects of being bedbugged, I supplied all my contact info and left immediately. That is the last I have heard from Casa de la Maria despite 3 emails and 2 phone calls. (I was asking for cleaning restitution and the two nights I was in Room 12 comped to me and that was all.)

The grounds? Hey, it's Montecito/San Ysidro Ranch country. It's gorgeou$!  And makes Santa Barbara look like a suburb of Bakersfield...And the staff was friendly and mostly helpful. The fact that they booked a rather loud and demanding group of guests midway through a silent Buddhist retreat? Eh, I get it.  Co-exist, people.  Just not w/ bedbugs.

review_info.review_text:
So good, that we went for breakfast and then again for lunch.

We really loved the gluten-free bread options. I have not had a sandwich in a long time.  It was so thick with turkey!

A very lovely restaurant with a salad bar (yes, really), open space, nice outdoor seating, and a comfortable bar area.

Savoy is impeccable.  Somehow every single item is delicious and fresh.  I always have a good experience.  The salad bar is for sure the best in the city.  The sandwiches, excellent.  The entrees, you guessed it, so good.  I would recommend them to anyone -- you gotta try it.  Note: closed Sundays!
Great food and service! I don't live in the area, but next time I'm in Santa Barbara,  I will definitely eat there.

Vino Divino is our favorite wine shop in Santa Barbara! They have an incredible selection of wines from all over the world, including a large number of spectacular local wines. Whenever we buy wine for our own enjoyment, for our events or for client gifts, this is our go-to spot.  They also have a great wine club and during COVID have been doing virtual wine tasting events which have been a lot of fun and a blessing on the Santa Barbara community during this challenging time. Thank you Vino Divino!

source.name: Valentino's Take N Bake Pizza
source.categories: Salad, Sandwiches, Restaurants, Pizza

review_info.review_text:
I don't know what took me so long to find this place but I love it. First off, they don't just make pizzas to go, they make amazing sandwiches! The Italian sub is by far my favorite. The rolls taste fresh and the meats are perfect! The combination of everything in the sandwich is just amazing! I'm not even a fan of sandwiches but this is my first choice of food there! 

Okay so the pizzas. I used to question why anyone would want to make their own pizza. Isn't the point to pay for someone to do the work for you? I moved beyond my high maintenance thinking after eating a pizza at a friend's house. It's NOT that difficult to throw it in the oven and the instructions are right on the packaging. The pizza came out of the oven smelling amazing and it was perfectly cooked! I took a bite and my goodness! Fresh baked pizza with little work put in! No cold pizza getting delivered to your house...just a yummy pizza perfectly cooked. And you can pick it up any time, put it in the fridge, and baked when you're ready for dinner! Genius! I appreciate the fresh ingredients and warm pizza. I can't pick a favorite pizza because they've all been amazing. Just go try one then try a second then a third...you won't regret it!
Always can depend on Valentino's for delicious food! Have been coming here since I was a kid and the food has consistently been tasty over all these years! Great sandwiches, pizzas and salads!

Hands down Shayre is an angel! This was our second time ordering a bulk order from this establishment and she got it done! We ordered 120 half sandwiches (100 turkey and 20 veggie) for new student orientation. She informed me that early bread deliveries recently have been tight bc of the pandemic, but the sandwiches were prepared and ready to go when I arrived! Shayre is such a sweet, hardworking individual and I highly recommend Valentino's for any event!

review_info.review_text: Great hidden gem sandwich shop. This place was recommended by a local and it did not disappoint.  Their deli sandwiches are awesome.  Great place to get snacks before you hit the lake or travel through to your next destination.

I love this place and used to eat here all the time (along with my partner), but was recently diagnosed with Celiac (so I can't eat my favorite food, bread). I WISH they had gluten free bread; then I could get my usual breakfast sand again! :(( 

Aside from that, great service and great food. Also love the little outdoor patio area; it's adorable and has plenty of benches and umbrellas for shade.

It's all boarshead and fits all very delicious. I cook with Boarshead meats at home but I've never made sandwiches this good. I wasn't expecting this to be in the middle of an RV park but it was a very nice break from a very long road trip. I'll be back every single time I drive through this area.

review_info.review_text: My husband and I been coming here for about 4 years and the menu is amazing but the people that you guys hire they need some serious training. My server was very skidish and seemed she was crying I believe her name was Sam but please put more professional looking people at this establishment not a good look for a hotel like this.

I would give this place a four and my husband rated it a three. I had the hamburger and fries and it was delicious and I love the the fig marinade they put in the hamburger. I had an IPA white walls and I liked it. My husband had pork belly and he thought it was OK. Our waitress was great she was very good came back and checked on us a few times. The menu is limited and it is in a hotel which we didn't know so little hard finding it.

This place was pretty nice the Decour was great,
 The service was fantastic my only complaint was some of the food. We first of had the brussels sprouts that were amazing for the  entrées we had the pork chop which was good as well but the fish tacos that were very disappointing. The tacos were very small and no taste. My wife and I were disappointed but then the desert came which was a berry pie which was amazing they made up for the disappointing  tacos.

source.name: Rusty's Pizza Parlor
source.categories: Restaurants, Pizza, Salad, Chicken Wings

review_info.review_text:
The night of the issue with my pizza, I went to their website and left a description of what happened. As of today, I have not had a response via email or phone. 

That certainly sums it all up, unfortunately.
Rustys is great for family and quick family dinners. A little salty so you will be up all night but the pizza is definitely worth it!

So, I placed an order last night with Rusty's off of Carrillo for delivery, as I had many times over the last decades (SB local). I was VERY specific in my delivery details, as my house is behind the main house on the property. I am unit A. About an hour later, my neighbor knocked on my door and was holding my pizza. He told me that he found it on his back porch. I was stunned, but, thankful that he found it. 

I took the pizza inside and when I opened the box, the pizza was cold (no surprise) and there was a piece missing. Yep, somebody had eaten a piece of it. I know it wasn't my neighbor, which means it was likely the driver (?), or maybe it was done at the pizza joint and he didn't check the box?? Either way, I was completely disgusted. We are in the middle of a pandemic and somebody touched/ate my food.  UGH. 

I called and spoke with a supervisor (Jonathan) and told him the story and told him that the pizza was on my front porch, as I refused to eat it and refused to order a replacement (I just didn't trust them not to mess with my food.) The driver came back and grabbed the pizza and I am supposed to be getting a refund. We'll see if that really happens. 

I will not order food from them again, which makes me sad. I have a 40+ year history of patronage at Rustys, but, this is not okay. Too bad.

responses.response: Rusty's Pizza Parlor, located at 232 W Carrillo St, Santa Barbara, CA, is a local eatery known for its pizza, salad, and chicken wings. The restaurant offers a casual ambiance and is good for groups. However, it doesn't provide WiFi and outdoor seating, though it offers take-out services and accepts reservations. Parking is available on the street and in a dedicated lot. It operates from 11 am till midnight from Tuesday to Sunday, with an exception on Monday when it remains closed. The business has received mixed reviews from customers, with an average rating of 3 stars. One customer praised the pizza as being worth it for quick family dinners, while others expressed dissatisfaction over the restaurant's customer service and delivery issues. One customer reported a problem with their food being eaten before delivery and a lack of proper response to issues raised.

source.name: Little Alex's
source.categories: Restaurants, Mexican

review_info.review_text: Drove there and it was under construction. Yelp said it was open & looked through the window and paint cans and cutting supplies glore.

I've lived in Cito for 30+ years. When I was a kid we'd often come here for family dinners. We always had a great time and the food was tasty. We call their chicken soup "sick soup" and request it every time we have a cold or flu. It used to be delicious. (Even though they've always used frozen veggies and the chicken is terribly dry). This place has gone so far downhill in the past years. There is no flavor. It's about as Americanized as it can be, maybe dumbed down for SB's growing intolerance for spice. This is as close to Mexican food as the $2 tacos from Jack in the box.

So so so good. Traveling from Austin, TX and naturally wanted some Mexican food with my family. Service was amazing, very kind employees. I did not catch her name but the employees was helpful & always made sure our chips were refilled. It was very good! Throughout the whole meal my family and I kept commenting on how good the food was. Thank you!!!

source.name: Third Window Brewing
source.categories: Nightlife, Beer Gardens, Breweries, Food, Beer, Wine & Spirits

review_info.review_text: Best smash burger around, great atmosphere, good beer, nice outdoor patio. Delicious tri tip sandwich special. Nice locals spot surrounded by cool coffee spots & a terrific speakeasy cocktail spot at night.

Third Window is a cool spot. They serve delicious beers, have a mellow vibe, and the service is great. We've been here on the weekend a couple times and they serve delicious Smashburgers as well. Prices are reasonable. 

They are located in "The Mill", which also has a wine spot and restaurant. Great family spot for some beer drinking. Check it out.

Great selection of beers and love the location. I don't love beer but they had a few I could chose from plus the municipal wine is next door for you wine lovers like me. We heard the burgers were amazing but they only serve them some days. Might want to call as they have pop up cuisine on different days. Great Vibes and drinks!

source.name: Opal Restaurant & Bar
source.categories: Seafood, American (New), Sandwiches, Steakhouses, Restaurants, Bars, Nightlife

review_info.review_text: This was the first time we visit the restaurant, we were looking for a place to have a new year dinner and celebrate my daughters birthday , I looked online and saw that they have a special dinner and a band playing , the food looks good in the pictures and they had a good review so we decided to try it. We had an amazing time, the food was delicious!!! We had appetizer soup /salad main chorus and dessert. our waitress was amazing (sorry I forgot her name)!!, the band was great. They let me bring a cake and we celebrate my daughter birthday right after midnight. Highly Highly recommend , thank you again for an amazing night , what a great way to start the year

My daughter wanted a large wedding filled with family and friends but, COVID made that impossible right now. She and her fiance really wanted to be married and so, they decided to have a simple private wedding on the lawn of the Santa Barbara Courthouse with dinner afterwards at Opal restaurant. Only the my daughter, her fiance, my husband, our other daughter and our grandchildren were there. I wanted to do something to help make this day memorable and special for them. I reached out to Richard, owner and event coordinator of Opal. Over a few weeks and with many emails between us, Richard and I put together what was simply the best mini reception the newlyweds could have had and, somehow we managed to keep it a secret.
From suggestions for appetizers, to working out details of timing, to having his staff find a way to separate us from the other diners in their cozy and comfortable parklet (the restaurant was packed) and set a beautiful table with a floral centerpiece and rose petals I provided, Richard showed great understanding and appreciation of what I was trying to accomplish. He's a truly kind and caring man. To top it all off, the food was spectacular! The service was outstanding! I would recommend Opal Restaurant highly for any special event and absolutely for a lovely and delicious dinner.
Went here before a show at the theater next door. We said we were seeing a show in an hour. Ordered food and it was coming out a few minutes later. Great food, great service, great outdoor seating!!

source.categories: Juice Bars & Smoothies, Breakfast & Brunch, Brazilian, Restaurants, Food, Salad, Acai Bowls

review_info.review_text:
Our hosts Roberta and Mestre Daniel Yoshimi (aka Prof. Chin) provided an excellent menu of the favorite foods of Brazil (o Brasil, em português). One who appreciates tasty-good food simply cannot stay away very long. My tri tip was delicious, and the multiple traditional sides were exactly on-point. (Prices are friendly too.)

I used to visit this establishment weekly to take part in great African drumming classes, and it's fun to revisit the festive atmosphere and food. They present their cuisine and culture with hospitality, nuance and great cooking skills.

#HighlyRecommended

my boyfriend and I went here for dinner and it was a nice experience :) we each got a caipirinha to drink which was good and my boyfriend LOVED the stroganoff! My Brazilian cesar was good and the brigadiero which we got to go was AMAZING! I would go back to try more! The lady told us to make ourselves at home which was a sweet sentiment!! The people were very nice :,)

The restaurant facility itself may not look all that elegant and appealing but the service and the food really blows that away. They serve food for each meal of the day but I personally would recommend going for breakfast and trying one of their acai fruit bowls. Slightly on the pricier side but so worth it and you will be healthily full for hours to come! The culture here is also something that is unique and interesting. Great place for family brunch!

The restaurant also offers African drumming classes, contributing to its festive atmosphere. Other customer favorites include the caipirinha drink, stroganoff, Brazilian cesar, and brigadiero. The restaurant's service is praised and the cultural experience it provides is considered unique and interesting.

source.name: Pascucci
source.categories: Gelato, Food, Restaurants, Italian, Vegetarian, Gluten-Free

review_info.review_text: Crème brûlée was delish. Service a little slow but expected during covid. Great ambiance and outdoor seating

It's hard enough to go out to dinner as a parent. Unfortunately for us, Laura (the hostess) was there to make it even more difficult. From the minute we started speaking to her she was unpleasant and dismissive. Our server (did not get her name) was very pleasant and offered to move us to the patio where it would be warmer. Our 2 year old started to fuss a bit, and Laura took it upon herself to let us know we would need to
move our stroller if she needed to sit someone next to us (there were several tables available... starting to see why). Less than a minute later, she sat the very next couple right next to us, as I was trying to wrangle my 2 year old. (Once again, plenty of tables). It was clear she did so to make us uncomfortable, and it worked. We decided to take our business elsewhere. It is really unfortunate since I've had so many pleasant experiences here, which I why I wanted to take my family. I can confidently say we will not be back.

We have enjoyed pascucci's for so many years now and just went tonight. It's always wonderful. I usually get the Bellagio pasta, but tonight got the ravioli sampler, in the mood to try each one. So good. Not sure which one was my favorite, had to keep tasting. We sat outside in a covered patio with a lovely warm heater. The garlic bread is such a treat. Such generous portions, went home with a great lunch for tomorrow. If I don't raid the fridge tonite....

source.name: Fernando's Churros
source.categories: Desserts, Restaurants, Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Delis, Food Trucks

review_info.review_text: Best churros I've ever had so far! Hot, fluffy, and crispy. Oh my sugary goodness, I'm salivating as I am writing this review. LOL. Portion size was quite generous for the price. I recommend eating them fresh! 10/10 recommend!
Best churros in town! perfect for events or even as a grab n go if you stop by at their location. A super friendly and family owned business. these churros never fail

In celebration of Latinx Heritage Month, my sweet tooth couldn't help itself but to share quite the hidden treasure in Santa Barbara:
Fernando's Churros.
Off a Westside side street...
behind Rosale's Mexican Restaurant and Auto Zone...
in a vacant parking lot...
sits the bright orange Fernando's Churros truck. 

Bring those bills, henny!! 
Once you get a whiff of the fresh churro dough blended with cinnamon and sugar, you'll be crunching it like it's hot!

Fernando is super sweet and easy going. Once I didn't have cash and his card reader wasn't working--he said to just come back another day to pay him. Doesn't get more trustworthy and local than that! 

Their truck slogan reads: "PRUEBA--DISFRUTA--REPITE! (Try...Enjoy...Repeat!)". Just like that, you'll be an addict and regular like myself! 
Oh, heck, he knew I'd be back for my fix. 

Fernando also does catering for large events (quinceañeras, weddings, etc) with the toppings (chocolate and caramel sauce), plus offers local delivery!
Note: Keep in mind that they're there only in Santa Barbara Mondays and Thursdays but travel to Lompoc, Vandenberg and Lompoc the remaining days of the week.

Since I'm such a Churro fan, check out where else in Santa Barbara County to get your churro on--though none can triumph Fernando's!
https://www.yelp.com/collection/Y3ZRTDE_Iu9CUfDN3Dq4FA?utm_content=Collections&utm_source=ishare

review_info.review_text: Good sushi for the price! Enjoyed the rainbow roll and always enjoy the CA roll!!!!!!
The foods are very delicious and enjoying viewing of Santa Barbara harbor.I love to go again this place

Fresh sushi on the harbor at reasonable prices. The place doesn't look attractive inside to order and the guy taking the orders isn't smiling but the food will make you smile.  We've been several times now and we order something different every time. Top faves are red dragon, caterpillar and rainbow rolls. Also the hand rolls have all been delicious.  We plan to try the poke bowls next. There are only a few tables outside so it's best to take to-go. Be careful with the birds above the tables, we saw one table get a gross surprise from them.

source.name: Del Pueblo Cafe
source.categories: Mexican, Restaurants

review_info.review_text: Ordered food to go , it was cold . Everything was cold . I only have a 30min lunch break , so I didn't go back to return it. I did not enjoy it at all one bit. Pretty upsetting. I payed $20 something for food and drink . The drink tasted pretty flat , no flavor. Plz go somewhere else for Mexican. Los Arroyos or Los Agaves is better and tastier. I rather do NO STARS on this place , but looks like I have too . Sucks I payed soo much and for nothing. I am not returning, however I will let my friends and family know my situation there .

What can be said about this spot? Well, nice, cozy, comfortable, and hip environment with authentic Mexican decor to enjoy delicious Mexican dishes offered here! Salsa is spicy tomato sauce based, beans between whole and smashed, soups full of vegetables which comes in handy during flu season! And....they also serve hot Mexican chocolate served in hearty mugs! Recommended!

Outdoor seating is an option! This place can be peaceful at certain times of the day, like a Sunday...early evening. 
The decor inside is super artsy and does help one to leave the daily grind in a different way. The environment really is different inside, in a cool way. I hope to eat inside again, when it feels more comfortable.
I have mixed feelings about the plates here. I haven't loved my combination plates, but my burritos have been very satisfying! Right now my favorite item on the menu is the Chile Relleno Burrito. The cheese chile relleno is fresh, huge and delicious. I like the moist rice within the burrito, and delicious beans as well. I'm curious to try the house-made mole, chile verde and torta in the future. This is a very unique restaurant. They serve unsweetened mango iced tea as well! Our server was very nice, and refilled our drinks. For now, I will stick to takeout and the patio, until it feels safer to eat inside. That Chile Relleno burrito is comfort food with some nice salsa.

source.name: Jeannine's American Bakery Restaurant
source.categories: Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Bakeries, Restaurants, Coffee & Tea

review_info.review_text: Amazing! Delicious! Can't say enough. From food to atmosphere to service. Just perfect. Right way to end a holiday weekend.

A Santa Barbara staple! I used to go to the downtown location, but after that one closed, I haven't been to Jeannine's since. Man, have I missed it!

You order at the counter and then find a table either indoors or outdoors. The space isn't too big, so if you're with a large group, it may be difficult to find seating. Staff was super friendly.

If you're a sweet brunch person, the banana Kahlua French toast is a MUST! The challah bread is fluffy and not too eggy as some french toasts can be, and the caramelized, Kahlua glazed bananas on top are sweet goodness. The Norwegian Benedict was nice and light with the smoked salmon, tomatoes, and cucumbers. The breakfast burrito was too heavy for me though. I loved the grilled tortilla, but the fillings alone were quite mushy. The crispy home fries on the side and salsa were much needed to add a bit of crunch and to cut the richness of the cheesy eggs and bacon. Nonetheless, Jeannine's honestly has a special place in my heart, and it's because of that banana Kahlua French toast!

Jeannine's is a nice breakfast and brunch spot across from the wharf with ocean views. I ordered a simple two egg breakfast with toast and fresh squeezed orange juice.  I placed a to go order and enjoyed my breakfast in the sand! 

The staff were very welcoming and quickly took my order. While I waited, I noticed how cute and quaint this place is. I was quickly served and left to the beach to enjoy. I would say my breakfast was about 3.5 and the juice and service was a 5! My eggs and potatoes were meh and sourdough was good. I think next time I will try a pastry (that seems to be the thing to get at Jeannine's).

responses.response: Jeannine's American Bakery Restaurant is a well-loved food establishment located at 3607 State St, Santa Barbara, CA. The business, which operates from 7:30 to 13:30 from Wednesday to Sunday, offers a wide variety of food, breakfast & brunch, baked goods, and coffee & tea. It also provides free Wi-Fi and outdoor seating, making it a good spot for groups. Street and lot parking are available, and they offer takeout service. The ambiance is both casual and classy, as described by customers. The restaurant is highly rated with a 4-star business rating. review_info.review_text: Every time I order cinnamon twist I order online and I pay for a extra icing and all the time I ask to make sure they put 2 and they say they do and by the time I get home I only have 1 in the box very frustrating I kind of trust the employees to not lie and do they're job correctly management can you provide some adequate training to there employees representing your company
Muy mala pizza muy aguada y muy mala atención y cara para rematar tenía un sabor muy desagradable y l atención pésima

Bad experience! I ordered a "special" over the phone for pick. The deal was $7.99 for a large 3 topping pizza (including hand tossed). When I arrived for pick up, they had upped the price by a few dollars! I was told it was because of more than 3 toppings. When I pointed out that there were 2 toppings covering the entire pizza, and then a split where it was 1/2 of one topping and another 1/2 of a different topping still equals 3 toppings. She had to get the manager. The manager then told me it was because I had ordered 1/2 side with Anchovies (trying to eat "better" ). I said that should have been disclosed when I ordered. I walked... they did not hold up to their end of the bargain and did not inform me of the increase of price on the phone! I would have been ok if I knew ahead of time of the extra charge, or would have ordered different toppings. Or the manager could have just taken care of the fact her employee did not clarify the charges when I ordered. She didn't - NO CUSTOMER SERVICE. Haven't been there in a LONG time - Most likely it'll be months to a year before I try again! Wow!

source.name: Mesa Verde
source.categories: Garage Door Services, Restaurants, Live/Raw Food, Food, Home Services, Mediterranean, Keys & Locksmiths, Burgers, Vegetarian, Juice Bars & Smoothies, Vegan, Salad

review_info.review_text: It's always fun to try a new vegan place and this one doesn't disappoint. Super fresh, delicious and inventive. The squash blossom quesadilla was delicious (the blue corn tortilla was out of this world). The staff was also super friendly.

Pretty disappointing. I've been wanting to eat here for several years based on what I thought was a great reputation in town.  I don't get over to the Mesa much but when I saw a coupon in a mailed flyer a couple months ago, I clipped it.  It offered a free entree with purchase of one entree and two drinks. Even with a discount of $12, the bill was $53 for lunch (before tip) -- I can eat a great dinner out for less than this -- so I was expecting a very delicious meal.  Both my companion and I felt the food was vastly overpriced for the quality, flavor and even presentation. The quantity was generous enough but the items we ordered (empanadas and the mushroom burger) were both rather bland.  The "burger" was served on a doughy, barely cooked pita-like bread rather than on an appropriate item to hold a messy burger in place like a brioche bun.  It was completely falling apart after a few bites... which would have been okay to eat with a fork except it was just not flavorful or complex given the list of ingredients. The most interesting item was the ketchup made from beets.  Also the side fries weren't thoroughly cooked except for the smallest ones.  Definitely not a $24 item! The empanadas were somewhat better but again, not a 'wow' and not even a 'hey, really tasty.' Just bland and again, not worth $24.  The half-off discount didn't even cover the $13 cost of a chai tea and lemonade (that was mostly ice of course).  All in all, very disappointing food and therefore completely overpriced.  We took the food to go so I cannot really comment on the service. When I read another lengthy review (12/5/21), I now see that the prices have been jacked and the quality has been wavering. I totally understand the precarious state of the restaurant business right now during covid but I cannot recommend this restaurant at this time.
Flavors are always spot on! Service is also good. Best fusion snd vegan food in Santa Barbara.

review_info.review_text:
i've been really craving thai food and i've not have thai food in santa barbara. however, everything here is kind of subpar to me sadly (i say this as in i have had better) in a way, everything here is weirdly healthy??? still, i think they have a decent pad thai! their pineapple fried rice was just kind of plain and looks a little sad and not colorful. to be real idk how this stuff is cooked "authentically" but there's just something off about it. the egg roll was good, just a good ol egg roll. and their papaya salad was also okay! their curry was also okay i think everything was okay and i'm not mad at it just a little sad
their service is good! the ladies are super cute and they r the reason why i would go back

Excellent food great service. I'm found this place on a whim and so glad I did!
Go here get the curry and make sure you're able to get a Thai iced tea!

I love a pad thai, but so many places make them so heavy, this was crisp and bright flavored- so good.

Ordered some Pad Woon Sen for takeout in my hotel room,  I must say, the PWS exceeded my expectations.  It was flavorful and a delight with every mouthful.   The glass noodles and vegetables had the  right amount of chew.  It was such a satisfying meal.  Thumbs up to the chef!

review_info.review_text: This place always being one of my favourite! Friendly owner and Foods are sooooooooooo good! I love their homemade dumplings, Chicken popcorn, Taiwanese sausage, pork belly bowl, special carts noodle and lamp skewers!!

Place has amazing homemade dumplings that I can't get enough of. The staff is very nice and helpful. I went for the soft opening and while it wasn't perfect, they did all they could to make the service amazing, and it worked. They also serve Mala Tang, which I tried, and it was really good. The medium spicy is exactly as it sounds like. They also have other items I haven't tried yet but I will definitely go back for more!
A bit pricey for just a simple dumplings n malatang ( the spicy soup) ... But it taste good... Just not worthy to go back again.

source.name: Petit Valentien
source.categories: Restaurants, Ethiopian, French

review_info.review_text:
Husband and I walked by Petit Valentien this afternoon and the Ethiopian lunch dishes we saw on the patio looked great, so we stopped in for dinner about 30 minutes ago. We weren't in a huge rush, but we didn't have hours to dine, because I had dough proofing at home and needed to attend to it. Hubby walked in and checked in with waitress and came out saying we should take any seat we wanted and she'd be right out with menus. So, we sat next to the Xmas tree on the patio and waited... and waited... and waited.

We figured she couldn't see us so we moved right next to the front door, where she couldn't miss us. After waiting several minutes, I decided we would wait 5 more minutes and then find somewhere else for dinner. After 3 minutes, a 30-something brunette waitress came and dropped off menus. I let her know the table was wobbly and she said she'd bring a block for it (which she never did). Oddly, I detected a twinge of attitude from the waitress with that exchange... not sure why, but there was an element of nastiness in her tone. She also turned on the table-side heater, which was very effective, if somewhat atmosphere-killing, because of its very bright coils.

I pulled up Yelp to look at the pics of the entrees and we settled on what we wanted to order. After about 5 more minutes, the waitress returned and informed us that dinner would take longer here than other restaurants. I let her know I was proofing dough at home and if we ordered immediately, how long would it take. She replied that if we ordered faster, the food would come faster. (Duh! Crazy how that works!) Again, a twinge of nastiness.

Hubby and I heard the specials and I asked her to repeat the sides on one of the specials. Attitude was ramping up from her. I asked her what her favorite item on the menu was and she replied, "I can't say. You're the one who's going to eat it, not me! The chef wouldn't even tell you." 

I didn't dare ask another question, because she was in full beeeyatch mode. We both ordered off the regular menu. Then, she said it would be 20 minutes and we ordered wine. Before she left, I asked the waitress if she could please ask the chef not to hold the entree until we finished the appetizer... just to put it all in at once. Her response? "The chef doesn't need to be micromanaged like that." And that, my Yelp friends, was my limit to the abuse I was going to take from this witch of a waitress.

I smiled and said thank you, but we aren't going to stay. She said okay, opened the door, walked into the restaurant, and I could hear her behind me exclaiming with a groan as she entered, "Oh my Gaaaaawwwdd."

Good thing they're in a tourist zone, because Petit Valentien can have a fresh supply of customers the waitress can abuse. As for this local, I'd recommend one of our other many fine dining establishments and give this one a wide berth, if service is important to you.

Two last comments: First, we noticed the restaurant had a Help Wanted sign posted, looking for servers, which could hint that maybe the attitude starts at the top and they have a hard time keeping servers. Second, I noticed another one of the local Yelp Elite crew (and other reviewers) also commented on the rude and inattentive service here. Seems to be a trend and unfortunately, it was our unlucky turn to experience it tonight.

Just don't go. They are severely understaffed and incredibly rude. We had to walk out after the waitress ignored us for about 15-20 minutes. We had to ask her three times to let us know what the wait time would be. Very unprofessional.

Amazing experience with a variety of Ethiopian flavors giving it the right touch. A story in flavors you need to experience. Lovely location feels like your in another world.  
Great service.

source.name: Bogo SB
source.categories: Food, Food Delivery Services, Burgers, Pizza, Caterers, Event Planning & Services, Restaurants

review_info.review_text:
Good food, surprisingly easy ordering process. 

I often confuse this spot with Mizza and the adjoining 1114 restaurant. To my knowledge, they are under the same ownership. I order through Grubhub as all three spots offer crazy coupon discounts. Delivery, tax, and the driver fee will rack the price way back up so I opted to pick up from the location today. 

The restaurant is named after their buy one, get one free pizzas. I've tried and they are amazing! Great value. Tonight, I ordered a burger which is the same one cooked at 1114. It's large, full of flavor, and comes with a hearty serving of seasoned fries. 

BOGO is located within 1114. As soon as you enter the doors, take an immediate left where you will be greeted by a white counter with their logo. They appear to operate separately from the main restaurant. I was immediately helped by 3 different employees and appreciate how efficient they all were. My food was warm and packaged well!

I will be back soon.

Normally we get pizza here because it's always buy one get one free for pizza but I decided to get a burger, fries, cakes and beer. We decided to pick up the order and heads up, it has a sign that says eleven and is  near the turtle pond in the plaza behind Anderson's, near the museum, state and fig...I guess they took over eleven during covid?
I added lettuce and raw onions to my house burger and it was delicious. The chipotle sauce and angus burger patty combination went straight to my tummy and their beer batters fries adds a good texture.  We added a growler last minute and wife thought it looked like a juice jug. Lemon cake was ok but moist, but I ordered it for the wife and she said it reminded her of a cake from a grocery store.  The flourless chocolate cake had a thick fudge consistency- which I like but flavor wise was ok. Price for the cakes were not worth it in my opinion ( would rather go to Anderson's or lilac for that price). I will most likely order from here again- pizzas are good price and burgers were delicious.  Wife got Sb munchie burger so we could compare... I thought the burger here looked and tasted better

best place most amazing taste and the deal of a life time great customer service wow no more thinking on what and where to go its bogo all day thankx again for the delicious pies I ordered the caramelized onion and meatball and the BBQ chicken omg these are killer quality extra ricotta on the meatball one for just a  dollar

source.name: Montecito Confections
source.categories: Restaurants, Bakeries, Food

review_info.review_text: Ordered a white cake with buttercream. When I placed the order they suggested a light lemon cream filling which I went with. It was beyond perfect. Light fluffy buttercream, moist cake, and the filling was a perfect match up. Yep, I will be back!

Katie baked the wedding cake of my dreams. It came out exactly as I wanted and was delicious. We had three tiers: two were red velvet and one was vanilla custard cake with fresh raspberries. I am very happy with our decision to choose her.

Katie Teall is an ANGEL!!!  I made a wedding cake for the daughter of a very close High School friend and the Fondant I bought (FondArt) was horrible.  I spent about 7 hours kneading it and rolling it, and no matter what I did when I covered a tier of the cake it cracked.  I was so stressed that decided to go to Montecito Confections to see if I could buy Fondant there.  I got there and asked Katie Teall the sweet adorable, British owner if she could help me.  she explained that she sold the store and the rest of her Fondant was for the last 15 wedding cakes that she had to deliver during the summer.  She must have seen my face of stress, exhaustion, just lost, and asked:  How big is your cake?  I told her and she said:  Do you want me to cover it in Fondant for you?  I jumped to hug her and kiss her and hug her and kissed her some more.

I came home and the mother of the bride carried the bottom tier and we went back to Montecito Confections to be saved by Katie.  We arrived and she said where is the rest of the cake?  I did not want to take advantage so we just took the biggest tier.  She said:  Bring it!

Home we went after hugging Katie and kissing her some more and got help and left with two more tiers.  Katie my angel covered the three tiers!!! She was my angel.  The mother of the bride broke in tears, I guess she was worried that I was never going to serve the wedding cake.  These were tears of relief!  We ended up having the most beautiful cake and thanks to Katie.  Katie also build the cake, putting all three tiers together.  Then explained to me how to decorate it.  She told me to get a photo of the container of her fondant because she had tried all the different brands and that was the best of them all.  She said that mine was impossible to work with since it was too dry!  Katie is a walking ANGEL.  I love her, love her and love her.  All the kisses and hugs are not enough to thank her for saving the wedding cake and so much more.

review_info.review_text:
The girls were helpful and friendly 
But 2 customers were not wearing mask
11/12/20 12:45 pm
We were not happy there very not requesting
A mask or no service in iv

Reviewer: Ed F. from Central Valley, CA 
We visit our UCSB son often and shop at the grocery store around the corner from this Subway. We stopped in for lunch one day and wanted to 1st wash up and use the rest room. It appeared that it was not occupied however we asked 1st. We were told (with no disrespect to the culture but with a difficult to understand accent) that it was "out of order" we sensed differently since we saw someone exit the room after obviously using the facility. What? An employee can use the restroom and exit while picking away but lie to us about it being out of order? Too late to simply walk out since my son had already ordered and paid but my wife and I obviously changed our minds about ordering after seeing this employee exiting the restroom while picking for whatever. At least he put on his pocketed pre used plastic gloves when he returned to prepare food.
I have always had good service here and every once in a while they add a free cookie to a delivery meal. All-in-all an above average subway.

source.name: 101 Deli
source.categories: Delis, Restaurants

review_info.review_text: Everything is average at best. No taste to meat. Bread was possibly older than a day in the way it tasted. They were very nice but it was not as good as a Subway ot any chain.

This place is a small deli and they sell sandwiches and sushi. I ordered a tri-tip sandwich from here. The sandwich came with a half-foot French bread with red onions, tomatoes, lettuce, and tri-tip with mayo. It was mostly bread and there was barely anything in the sandwich. Overall, it tasted okay and the service is quick.

Just randomly saw this place on Yelp today and had to go try it as I'm Asian so I'm always on the lookout for new Asian places to try because I need my Asian food fix from time to time -- it's a special diet I have :P

I was a little skeptical based on their seemingly random array of food selections but I went for it anyways despite my husband saying he wasn't impressed with a sandwich he got there once.

To my delight, this place was totally awesome! It's a cute little deli in an industrial area so they get a lot of foot traffic during lunchtime from all the workers nearby. There's indoor and outdoor seating and the cute Asian couple that owns it are so nice and sweet. 

I got the lunch combo with chicken teriyaki and California roll -- it comes with miso soup, rice, salad and 2 egg rolls. The miso soup was authentic and delicious, the teriyaki chicken was sweet/savory and grilled to perfection with bits of charred ends, the egg rolls were hot and crispy, the California roll was fresh and moist, and the salad was tossed with a tasty sesame ginger dressing. In terms of flavor, it's honestly on par with a lot of real Japanese restaurant bento lunches. 

It was also a lot of food for under $15! I couldn't finish it all so I'll also have leftovers to eat for dinner tonight. I have yet to try the other menu items but I'll be sure to come back again soon!

review_info.review_text:
I was given two gift cards through my employer, and these gift cards are useless for online orders with delivery.
I contacted the company about the issue and was told they will fix it, and a month later it still is not fixed. It's as if Kyle's kitchen does not care about the customers to keep their word and fix this problem after saying they would.
Very poor integrity and poor leadership
Very good food, burgers, sandwiches, malts, fries and salads included, (an especially delicious ahi salad) with cheerful and timely service.

I have been a customer since they opened. Today, I ordered a classic Kyle's burger (super well done, no pink) and super crispy fries. After waiting 40 min while it was prepared to go, the burger was pink on the inside and the fries were floppy/greasy. Really terrible food today. Also, the girl working at the counter, and putting all the food together had her mask beneath her nose.  I love Kyles, but sorry to say this was not a good experience.

review_info.review_text: The food was really good, I was happily suprised. It was raining really hard outside so my only option was to Uber Eat some thing to my hotel room. The fajitas had a lot of flavor and was a pretty big portion. The rice was cooked very well, the only thing that could've used more flavor was the side of beans.  I forgot was to ask for utensils so make sure to ask if you're getting delivery . I ordered a shrimp fajitas with a side order of steak, total was about 38 with the delivery fees. Would order again

Absolutely terrible pickup experience. My husband placed the order and I went to pick it up. When I arrived they said they had no order. Then they said they found the order, handed me a bag and charged me $72. I looked in the bag and found three items that we didn't order. Then She said oh no the order actually wasn't placed. Oh okay, so you were going to give me random food I didn't order? Replaced the order in person and waited 20 min. Horrible experience.

It was raining and we were looking for a warm meal. Staff was extremely friendly as we ordered at the counter. My husband and I spilt the chicken fajitas and it was perfect with a side of beans and rice. Tortillas seemed handmade and the salsas were delicious. Hibiscus margarita was fantastic!!

source.categories: Mexican, Restaurants

review_info.review_text: We loved this place! We stayed at the hotel for a couple of days and had most of our meals here. The staff was great as well as the owner who is really a great guy. I don't understand the negative reviews but I guess that happens time to time.

This place is really convenient if you're staying at the hotel in the same parking area. I ordered the ribeye and I gotta say the flavor is underwhelming  I guess I expected too much in that it would be steakhouse quality but it's not.  It's more like average coffee shop quality so I'm not impressed. The flavor also was lacking a bit as it's not seasoned all that well.

I'm not sure how this place is getting good reviews. I'm staying at the hotel because my daughter is hospitalized at cottage. Having to spend Thanksgiving in the hospital really bites but we were with family. My husband didn't want to eat the hospital food so suggested the restaurant. They had a special menu as it was Thanksgiving. I ordered it to go to eat dinner with our daughter. When I got it back to the hospital room I couldn't be more disappointed. $20 plate of barely any food. I let my husband eat mine and I had what the hospital served which was half the price double the food and better quality. I mean there were literally 4 green beans and 3 carrot slices in each container. We will not be eating here ever again. What a rip off.

review_info.review_text: Been here a few times because there are really not that many Chinese foods in town. The food overall was on the salty side, but not as bad as the mandarin palace on la cumbre. The food was also pretty oily but okay for once in a while. Watch out for old waitress trying to persuade you into ordering expensive dish. We got tricked one time and ended up ordering roasted duck but we just wanted a bowl of noodles in the first place. Never going back again!
Best Chinese food and buffet in town. A wide variety of choices, all very tasty. Good service. To be concise, an eating experience I've yet to have anywhere else They will be missed.

Just had dinner here with some friends and family. The service was great. The food was fantastic. I had the buffet and I had many choices. Very sad this place is closing soon. Would have loved to have many more good times here. You will be missed.

source.categories: New Mexican Cuisine, Restaurants, Mexican

review_info.review_text: Terrible service. No utensils. Menus had typos everywhere. Food took forever and wasn't very hot. Duct tape and graffiti on the walls. Knew it was going to be bad but gave it a shot. Wish we hadent.
Food was great! Very accommodating to our group of 13- best Mexican a girl could want on the 4th of July!

review_info.review_text: I'm surprised this place has such a low rating. I've come a handful of times and always had great service and food. Definitely check this place out if you're looking for a casual lunch spot.

What a disappointment!  We were here 2 years ago at the old location and it was fantastic.  The original place was bustling, not here.  What happened?  The sandwich menu changed and not a wide selection of pastries anymore.  I ordered the half chicken pesto sandwich on multi-grain and salad.  The corner of the crust was so hard as if it was old with very thinly sliced chicken.  Very ordinary and this came out to over $10.  My friend ordered her sandwich and asked for sourdough but got white bread instead.  'We will not be coming back!

review_info.review_text: We stopped by here for lunch. Aksum is a great option for Ethiopian food in Santa Barbara. The staff was super friendly and the food was delicious. We tried the vegetable combo and meat combo since it was our first time here and we wanted to try some things. It was all delicious and I would probably roll with one or two of the combos next time around as well. Injera was on point and overall we had a great lunch. Thanks Aksum!!

A friend an I were excited to try this place. I recently moved from San Diego to SB, and was really hoping to find some great Ethiopian food. We got the veggie combo, and it was honestly amazing. The service was outstanding!! We were there for my birthday, and they made me feel as home as I've felt in SB. Highly recommend.

Went here for  lunch today. Wasn't Planning on stopping here but people's plates looked amazing. So glad we did. I have always heard Ethiopian food was amazing so I was excited to try it and so glad I did. Got the meat platter and shared with a friend and thoroughly enjoyed it. I will be back. Bummer they're only open for lunch. They share the location with the carribean restaurant too.

source.name: Luna Grill
source.categories: Mediterranean, Restaurants, Salad, Greek

review_info.review_text: We went to Luna after a hike in the Goleta butterfly sanctuary.   The food was served quickly, fresh and flavorful.  The service was outstanding.  The manager, Jacob, was great, politely checking on us a couple of times as we dined.

I seriously wish I could give this place a 4.5 but since I can't, they will get 4 stars. Their food is delicious and tastes fresh. I tend to order the gyro pita and have never been disappointed. I will say that I ask for extra tzatziki sauce because it can be a bit dry for my taste. The salad is nothing special but a nice side. The fries are a solid choice as well. I appreciate the indoor and outdoor seating and parking is plentiful. The reason for not giving five stars is the wait. I really feel like they need another cook in the back. If you order in-person, be aware that you will be waiting for some time. I now order online and they are usually pretty accurate with pickup time. Otherwise, great food!
Food is so good and Sheila was so sweet!! It was her first day and she was literally so nice. Thank you!

source.name: The Tully
source.categories: Bars, Karaoke, Nightlife

review_info.review_text:
Endearing little neighborhood watering hole. 

This is a spot I've driven by several times and have always been intrigued over. From the front, it looks like an old school neighborhood-style bar - and that's exactly what it is behind the door. 

When I was here last night, my eyes were immediately drawn to the fun Christmas decor. There were lights, stockings, and a tree. There's a long bar, a front and back patio, a juke box and a pool table. The place is dark and divey which I loved. I also noticed that there was a Monday-Friday happy hour which went to 7pm. It's rare to see a happy hour end as late as The Tully's, let alone on a Friday, so I fully took advantage of the perk. 

Our bartender was very friendly and helped us with menu selections. I took advantage of ordering a $5 happy hour draught beer and enjoyed it on the front parklet patio. The music is pretty loud in the bar so the outdoor space was a nice place of solace. 

This is a great spot with good service, and I will be back soon for sure.

Came in for a drink while I was visiting the westside. Greeted with the best service providing a positive energy while educating me about different tequilas and lagers. Learned about the famous Micheladas they make, ordered two! Thank you tully! You changed my life in a real positive way and I will be sure to come back and tell all of my friends. Can't wait until old school night!
Alma's the best. Nice outdoor patio , pool, and a laid back atmosphere, this is the local neighborhood bar no need to dress to impress everyone is casual.

Customers particularly appreciate its extensive happy hour, which runs from Monday to Friday and extends until 7 pm, a rarity in the area. The Tully also offers free WiFi and is a great spot for groups. The venue features outdoor seating and a pool table, adding to its casual vibe. However, it's worth noting that parking options are limited as there are no garage, street, validated, lot, or valet services available. Customers also highlighted their memorable experiences with the educational drink services and festive decor during the holiday season.

source.name: El Pastorcito
source.categories: Mexican, Restaurants

review_info.review_text: Hit this place up 2 nights in a row and if I was in town one more night I'd do it again. Mulitas de pastor were on point, we also had mulitas de pollo, tacos de birria and pastor. Horchata drinks. Large. See you next time.

Yes! Soo good. Drove by the El Pastorcito Mobile 3 nights in a row on our way to our hotel and would see a crowd of people at this taco truck every night. (East Beach on S Milpas St) They have tables set up and some lights. It's a fun scene. We decided to check it out. So glad we did. Go get you some al Pastor tacos and burritos and all of it. 
We had the birria tacos too - which were fine but nothing to go on and on about. But the el pastor... damn good! Squeeze on some lime, a splash of the salsa verde. Game ON! 
Would go back again and again. In fact we did - we got back in line and got another taco and burrito the same night because it was SO good.
GO!
First time trying them. I ordered the tripa tacos and an asada mulita with an horchata. Everything was delicious. I will definitely be back to try the rest of the menu

source.name: Tiburon Tavern
source.categories: Karaoke, Nightlife, Dive Bars, Bars

review_info.review_text:
Divey but endearing spot. 

Prior to the other evening, I had only ever come here for their Friday night karaoke events. They have always been quite popular and there's typically a packed room. I feel that the gentleman hosting the event does a wonderful job and the music selection is superior. 

I came in this time around on a Thursday night, fiesta week, and there were surprisingly just a few other patrons. Talk about a hidden gem of a spot. Sandy, our bartender was friendly and efficient and made sure that our group was taken care of. 

The bar was clean and organized. Even the bathroom was tidy which is a rare occurrence for dive bars. I have only ever ordered beers from here but they do have a full selection for your needs. I like how Tiburon also has a modern jukebox which you can control from an app on your phone. Being able to select songs from the comfort of your seat beats the heck out of feeding money into some dirty machine. 

A good overall spot if you're looking to separate yourself from the craze of the downtown bar scene.

Amazing bar.  I'm from out of town and I heard of this place from multiple establishments.  Finally checked it out after a long days work and I have to say- it definitely delivered.  Nice spot, easy to get too,  with friendly local people that will strike up a conversation with you.  Special shoutout to the bartender Rosa who served the BEST drinks.  Ask for for a cocktail if you really want to be treated - that's her specialty!  Will definitely be coming back here when I can!

Great local watering hole. Been here a couple times while passing through Santa Barbara. Enjoy the place so much I usually spend more time there than I had anticipated. Staff and patrons are friendly. Definitely a no-frills dive bar. However, they do have a pool table.

source.name: Three Pickles
source.categories: Sandwiches, Restaurants, Delis

review_info.review_text:
Three Pickles, an innocuous name for a Goleta outpost with a local branch in downtown Santa Barbara, puts out a sandwich called The Goucho.  And that, friends, is just the beginning of a dream come true.  

This sandwich might just be at the very tippy top of the hot, messy, cheesy, roast beef creations I've ever sampled.  It's difficult to describe the coming together of the meat, cheese, and very little else -- there's optional bell peppers for those who want them -- piled high on a thin, crunchy and unbeatably tasty torpedo roll.  

Nice people here, working very hard to manage a large and obviously seasoned (no pun intended) repeat crowd of locals.  And to think I'd have never found it without the urging of friends whose home is serving as a retreat from the desert heat.  

The challenge:  staying away for at least a few days before I go back for another dive into sandwich nirvana.

My wife and always hope the Three Pickles sandwich shoppe is open when we fly into Santa Barbara Airport.  Today it was and they always deliver a great sandwich!.
Fast service, lots of options, well worth finding.
Only open from 10am to 3pm Monday through Friday.

I LOVE THIS PLACE. I come here for lunch breaks on work every so often and it is such a treat. I got the Goodland club the first time and now I can't get anything else it's so good!! My fiancé has had the meatball sub, pastrami, and Cuban. He loves them all but the Cuban takes the win. Super joyous atmosphere as well.

responses.response: Three Pickles is a popular sandwich shop located at 420 S Fairview Ave, Goleta, CA. As a restaurant and deli, it is highly rated with an overall business star rating of 4.0. Known for their unique sandwich creations like "The Goucho", they are praised for their tasty and generously filled offerings. Three Pickles also offers a variety of other options and is particularly loved for their Goodland club, meatball sub, pastrami, and Cuban sandwiches. review_info.review_text:
We decided to do take-out one night. Had no idea how SB Thai would compare to home. We loved this place. Fast, efficient an quite pleasant.
If they had used pork belly I wouldn't have know I wasn't at home. Delicious! Thanks
Just try it!  I hope the wonderful people and fantastic team that own it continue to pump out these absolutely fantastic dishes. Santa Barbara is lucky to have a restaurant such as this.

The food ended up being pretty good here for the most part but there were a few issues. I ordered a mild green curry with shrimp, which actually ended up being pretty spicy. They also left the tails on the shrimp. We ordered delivery through Restaurant Connection which was the only delivery option, and it took 1.5 hours and a dish was forgotten (not sure whether the fault or the restaurant or the delivery service) but we did get a refund after calling. Our friends did really enjoy the pork belly fried rice but the drunken noodles had a very high ratio of vegetables to noodles.

review_info.review_text: Imagine having your close friends with incredible musical talent be your wedding band -- that is what hiring the Radio Prophets to play at your wedding is like! From the start, they made planning so easy, and in the end delivered above and beyond all our expectations! They made our wedding celebration so special and unforgettable, our guests are still talking about the music. Everyone loved the beautiful piano acoustics for the ceremony, the classy jazz cocktail hour and then a phenomenal dance set which got everyone on the dance floor, old and young. Their energy, positivity was unparalleled. They genuinely set the entire tone of the evening and we are so grateful for the most unforgettable wedding celebration. Thank you Radio Prophets and wishing you guys so many more lucky wedding couples to celebrate with!!

This band ROCKS.  They played for my wedding and were incredibly accommodating with requests for our perfect day. They set up and handled everything including the pre-event visit to the property and sound check. Communication regarding details of the event were handled quickly and professionally. I am a musician myself and was confident that this group would be amazing and I highly recommend  working with them.

I booked this band for a launch party that I had!
Very professional. On time. They played, without taking long breaks.
The music flowed so well in the background. 
My guest kept asking where did I find them.
I also appreciated the versatility of their music. 
Gerri, the sax player was always willing to answer my questions, as well as meet in person. 
I would definitely recommend them for any special event that you might have coming up.
Two thumbs up!
5+ stars!

review_info.review_text: Loving the new restaurant Cielo in Carpinteria! Looks amazing, food was perfect and great prices! Service was five star and the pricing was 2 star but tasted 5 star!!!!! I'll definitely be back :))

CBG is out of business.  It is now Cielo.  There is a full bar, and the menu is a mix of flatbreads, burgers, tex-mex, assorted appetizers.  There is inside and outside seating.  Bar has 8 spaces so get there early.  I did not have a cocktail so I cannot comment on the bartenders mixing skills. Except I did observe the pop rocks martini...hmmm childhood memories ;)
I had the steak flatbread with onions and cheese.  Crust was paper thin and the steak was good but I was disappointed by a lack of seasoning.  The steak flatbread was overpriced for what you get.  The trip tip plate (tri tip, beans, rice and tortillas ) for 8 dollars looked like a better deal.

Today's agenda:  1. Head to Carpinteria  2. Try out the new Cielo's restaurant  3. Get food poisoning

Trust me this was NOT the intention.

My wife and I were so excited when Cielo's finally opened it's doors to the public after weeks of renovations after the take over of Cabo's.  Cabos' was one of our favorite go to spots for lunch and were hoping that Cielo's captured us as a regular the way it's predecessor did.

When we arrived we did notice the positives. The interior was definitely upgraded as the booths give it a more restaurant ambiance.  The bathrooms were nicely done and very clean.

We sat in the front patio overlooking Carpinteria Blvd and took our first look at the new menus.  First thing we notice were the prices were about 25% higher than Cabos which is cool if the food warranted that price.  It's the standard beach diner fare with a bit of a higher end take on it.  Sliders, burgers, chicken plates, salads, apps, etc.   Were were disappointed at the price of the drinks (house margs were $10) and NO pitchers of margs anymore!  That sucked as that was one of the highlights of Cabos.   

First time there we ordered the sliders.  Not bad but not great.  Heavy jalapeno overrode the beefy flavor of the meat.  They had a nice dessert menu and we ordered the carrot cake.  Not bad but the server had no idea where it was sourced from.  

The 2nd time we came we ordered the 1/4 chicken plate as that was our favorite dish at Cabo's.  Nightmare thru and thru.  Our plates arrived and we just looked at each other as the rice was in clumps.  Literally.  The rice and beans were cold to the touch and when we cut into the chicken it was RAW.   Dark pink RAW.  We called over the server and she apologized and took it back.  The same plates were returned with the same pieces of chicken grilled to a near burnt crisp (chefs revenge I'm guessing) and the rice and beans were still cold.  We called over the server to let her know and one of the owners came over to apologize.   We told her that we REALLY want to like this place as we LOVED Cabo's but the standards of the restaurant need to start with the standards in the kitchen and there is just NO care for the food here.  Even the cold beans had no flavor.  I texted my brother that we were here and his reply was "nice patio...terrible food".  

Anyway unfortunately unless there are some major changes in the kitchen I'm never coming back to Cielo's.   Post script the only reason I gave it 2 stars instead of 1 was the server was VERY nice and very helpful

review_info.review_text: Great Bartender, really knew how to make drinks.  Food kept changing.
The only great southwestern restaurant around. Green Chile sauce is amazing. Good customer service.

The kinks still aren't worked out. The service was awful and the food was worse. Server had no clue about the menu or wine (there aren't any local wines and only four choices, owner said they are working on it). Server had to go ask someone else every question we had and could only handle one question at a time. Then he would forget to come back with the answer.
The food took over 1.5 hours to be brought out. They said they were busy but the place is small and no one was upstairs. While waiting, I used the restroom and noticed that the kitchen is extremely small. No way they can be efficient in that space.
We were entertaining out of town guests (one is a chef in NY) and he wondered about the so called "award winning chef" so we looked up Jim Gartman online and they are a joke. The food is not good.
They brought out dirty water glasses (one had lipstick on it). For a new place, it still seemed dirty.
The management doesn't seem to know what they are doing. They comped our meal since it took so long but even after they realized their mistake, it still took too long. 
Not worth the trouble and many other better options. My chef friend said the place won't last 6 months.

source.name: Modern Times Academy of Recreational Sciences
source.categories: Beer Bar, Breakfast & Brunch, Vegan, Bars, Nightlife, Restaurants

review_info.review_text: Such a great vibe there! I absolutely love Modern Times beer! I have been such a fan since my first Orderville and have followed deep into Monster's Park: Mexican hot chocolate edition! Mostly IPAs and barrel-aged stouts but everything is awesome. The vibe here is amazing and can't wait to come back, the staff is very friendly but...I must say, the girl working the gift shop in the brown plaid was seriously the sweetest! So friendly and so helpful. If everyone had employees like her, their business would be much more successful. She was very personable and relatable and also had great selections to offer. She even gave me good advice on a hoodie and also a "road-soda" to take with me! Her words were, "the ethereal embrace is fun to say and such a great treat at the end of a shift." She was absolutely right! What a treat to sip, on the way back to OC. This location needs to do what they can to keep her around because she is EXACTLY why people return to places like this. Not just because of the environment but because of the people who make the environment great! I unfortunately didn't catch her name but she is a keeper! Thank you again for such a great experience during my first time at a Modern Times location, you're what makes these places great, I thank you.

The Quick: INSANELY amazing food and awesome beer (lots of sours which we love). Get the munchwrap supreme ... Similar to a Tb favorite but plant based. Everyone who's been here has had trust issues after trying to vegan food... No one believes it's plant based. It's delicious, creative and sooo indulgent.  Enjoy yourself!
Best beers in town. Great vegan food and outdoor patio space as well. The staff is very knowledgeable about beers. The interior decor is really nice too.

source.categories: Restaurants, Bakeries, Food

review_info.review_text: I am truly beyond sad that Xanadu is closing due to a greedy, out of town landlord who has tried for years to drive the owner out. To lose such a wonderful bakery and a delightful place to linger over coffee or breakfast/lunch is a travesty! Exquisite bakery goods for parties, holidays, etc. are truly not available elsewhere. The owner is so nice and friendly making those of us who are regular customers feel like family. Her family members and employees have always made us feel the same. I am so sorry you have been bullied out, we will miss you terribly!

Their pastry is made with crisco. Tastes Trimble and unhealthy.
They lie about the ingredients .
They have stayed in business because people have such low standards.
Worst tasting pastry I ever had. Bad management bad service.
Only fools shop there.

Don't come here if you're craving sweets. The array of baked goods with pound you into submission. I had a ganache here and it was really good. Not legendary good in the sense that I would go out of my way to get it but good enough that if I find myself in the vicinity I might peak through that glass display one more time. 

At the time of this review I am craving an eclair. I'll edit my review later after I try it! If you would like to see how I rate the eclair, check back later? Bookmark the page.

The coffee here is ok, but don't have the mocha it's basically hot chocolate. But they are warm and tasty.

source.name: Angel Oak
source.categories: Restaurants, Seafood, American (New), Steakhouses

review_info.review_text:
Unfortunately, we came during the pre-fixed menu. There were no sides and no variety of appetizers. After reading the reviews of the food I was sad to see the menu look so bare and lonely. 
Our server was great, very friendly and the Sommelier was excellent. I chose the mushrooms, the lobster pasta and chocolate mousse. The mushrooms were hearty but the lobster pasta only had about 5 small pieces of lobster. My husband ordered the Ceasar salad, salmon and crème brûlée. He enjoyed his salad but the salmon filet was small.  With 3 (possibly small) 
 items per person, you may want to grab an appetizer in the lobby bar before you come. 
It also took forever to get each course. We were seated at 6:55pm and didn't leave until 9:25pm. My husband and son went back to the room while I waited at the table an additional 15 minutes for 2 cookies and a side of vanilla ice cream. I asked a manager who walked by to check on the dessert and to get me a copy of the itemized receipt. He seemed annoyed. Overall, maybe I'll return when the regular menu is back..

First off, I want to say all of the staff were amazing but we loved our server Autumn. She was so sweet and really knew the menu. We ordered everything she recommended. 

We got a bottle of wine to start, very crisp and light. Then for appetizers we ordered a dozen oysters which came in fresh from Baja, CA. I love that they provided a large amount of lemon, hot sauce and this amazing house made sauce. I could have eaten 100. One of the best selection of oysters we had. The quail and side salad was phenomenal. Just watch out for the little bones.

For dinner, I got the halibut which was so rich and tender I could barely scoop it up. It was very flavorful. Bae got the filet and potatoes which was cooked to perfection. We got a side of the cauliflower and it was the perfect side. 

We opted for the chocolate mousse cake since chocolate is my favorite but to be honest wouldn't recommend. I wish they would expand their dessert menu but overall great night sitting by the water!

Had a great time! Good service, drinks and food. Very knowledgeable. The filet mignon was amazing and finally found a place with a good bearnaise. Lots of tarragon and saffron on the menu. Would be 5 stars with a smidge lower price tag. The lighting was a little "shoe storey" but maybe because we were seated in the middle of the room. We also got wine recs starting close to $300. Apart from that a great experience.

Specialising in seafood, American (New) cuisine, and steakhouse-style dishes, the establishment holds a 4-star business rating. The restaurant offers validated and valet parking but does not have a dedicated parking lot or street parking.

source.name: Wingman Rodeo - Milpas Street
source.categories: Salad, Restaurants, Vegetarian, Chicken Shop, Chicken Wings, Sandwiches, Nightlife

review_info.review_text: Tried 8 of their different wings. I'd say the bourbon one was my favorite. I wasn't a huge fan of the Thai peanut or the Parmesan wings, but the rest that I tried were decent like the chipotle lime, lemon pepper, and cali bbq. I ordered a raspberry coco mead but i guess that didn't have it in stock so the guy behind the counter brought out two different raspberry flavored beers for me to choose from. They also didn't have the chili watermelon boochcraft so we ended up choosing a different flavor. It was pretty cold out, and we asked if the overhead heater could be turned on and the response was that the heaters weren't ready, not sure what that meant, but we just ate our meal without the heater turned on.

Hidden gem on Milpas! Love coming to this place especially for happy hour. Great outdoor patio seating and nice ambiance. I haven't tried their wings but I really like the sandwiches and tenders.  Great flavor and good crunch to the chicken !

Sorry... how did person say that it was good?  Paid $41 for 7 chicken wing pieces, 1 honey Thai burrito and fries and 2- 8ozs. Cokes.  Wings were dry . Burrito was overfilled with dry white meat and little slaw.. off balanced. I have 1/2 left of burrito and will give to the homeless.

source.name: Pro Karaoke System Rentals
source.categories: Party & Event Planning, Music Venues, Event Planning & Services, Nightlife, Arts & Entertainment

review_info.review_text:
The Mike is very service-oriented, friendly and gave great advice. He made it all very simple, and for me that could be a challenge,  the speakers were set up to provide great sound.
He is a local guy, knows all the best stories and really works to make it simple for you, but also a great deal of fun.

I celebrated my birthday with 15 friends recently, and rented a private event room in a local restaurant here in Santa Barbara. Mike was there right on time to set up the system and show me how to use it. When we were done for the night, we left the system there for him to pick up. Everything I needed was provided: a couple of mics, a few songbooks, and a signup sheet. The system itself was very easy to use, and I appreciated being able to adjust as needed, from the key of the song to the volume of both the music and the singer. It's nice not to have to shout to be heard over karaoke in a regular bar, and I loved being able to adjust the key even mid-song! The song selection was big and varied, and having the songbook available as a PDF was very helpful: several of us downloaded the PDF onto our phones/tablets, which made it easier to search for songs, both during and before the event. My friends and I had a blast! We loved not having to wait hours till our next turn, and experimenting with songs that we would ordinarily be too shy to try "in public". What a terrific service overall, and at such a great price. Can't wait to use this again for our next event!

We just used this service for about the fifth time...we use it for all of our parties.  Pro Karaoke Systems not only provides you with instant party entertainment, but the owner makes the whole experience SO easy.  First he emailed us a PDF version of the song book weeks in advance so we could pick out a few songs ahead of our event.  The machine comes with easy to follow personalized instructions and the owner will deliver and walk you through the whole setup as well. And last but not least, every time we've used this service the machine is always up to date with the latest hit songs, which makes the party that much more fun.  Highly recommended!

The karaoke system is user-friendly, allowing adjustments to song keys and volumes as needed. The company provides everything needed for karaoke, including mics, songbooks, and a signup sheet. The song selection is varied and updated with the latest hits. They are recommended for their terrific service, great prices, and for making parties more fun.
