source.name: 805 Kabob
source.categories: Mediterranean, Restaurants

review_info.review_text: Food is good but the worst service. No wonder it closed the owner has no knowledge of how to run a food business. I once called 7 times in one day and they didn't pick up, i go in the shop and they asked me "why didn't you call us to order". SMFH, glad it's closed

Considering the fact that this place is in Isla vista where most of the places don't really have good quality food, this one is worthy to check. Another plus point is the type of food. You can get kebab (lamb, beef, chicken) at very reasonable price. 

They can improve their professionalism. You might face a significant waiting time. But the guys who own the place are very nice and welcoming!

Have to disagree with rave reviews on this one. We were shown a menu and then told they only had about half of the items. Then picked something and were told they didn't have that either. Ended up ordering chicken, lamb, and beef. It took about twenty or twenty five minutes. We ate outside because the interior is so dreary and stuffy. Our order was correct. Food was acceptable but not anything I'll go back for.

source.name: Hustle & Grind Coffee Company
source.categories: Coffee & Tea, Food, Ice Cream & Frozen Yogurt, Restaurants, Cafes

review_info.review_text: I really liked this coffee shop! I just got a generic vanilla latte to be safe and I loved it. A little sweeter than usual but it's okay. I came around 5:40 so I got my drink made in minutes so it was a quick in and out. Located next to a lot of cute shops too!

Hustle & Grind is a really unique spot. I can't think of many coffee shops that also sell Hawaiian shaved ice, it's a pretty unique concept and I really liked the variety. The coffee is pretty good, just be careful because it is extremely hot. The service was incredibly fast and the staff was very friendly. There's no indoor seating but there are a handful of tables outside.
no almond milk anymore??? not vibes. Also was assured that the toast could be made gluten free and I had a allergic reaction.

source.name: Old Town Tavern
source.categories: Dive Bars, Bars, Nightlife, Karaoke

review_info.review_text: I've been in here twice during the past 2 weeks & its always borderline dead. The one bartender that actually talked to me I guess is only an emergency bartender who only gets to work when someone else cancels. Came in one night as a non-working employee was leaving. The bartender was in the back room for almost 10 minutes while I was waiting to order. The leaving employee was nice enough to serve me. The  Thursday bartender never greeted me afterwards, never asked if I wanted anything else, never said anything to me but played on his phone, watched an infommercial. I guess I'll be finding another bar for when I'm in town.

The bar tender there Matt Topete makes drinking at old town tavern an experience in its self, he is quick on the draw with a drink and may not be able to tell one but can take a joke. He knows more than most about sports and will have a conversation with any patron and make them feel right at home
Love the bar the people and the tenders. If you can find a liquor they don't have. They'll get it. Karaoke dj rocks the house best attentive dj ever again if he doesn't have a song he'll get it.

source.name: Night Lizard Brewing Company
source.categories: Food, Breweries, Beer Gardens, Mediterranean, Nightlife, Restaurants

review_info.review_text: The only hazy on the strip! Much lower key and chill than the other breweries, but still has a couple of tvs to watch the game while listening to some Reggae!

A fire pit, live music, delicious beer, and sales that support an eco-friendly, sustainable cause? Fantastic! This was the line on loop in my head a few nights ago at Night Lizard. After several visits to this State Street brewery, I can easily say it's one of my tops. Staff are friendly, beers are tasty, and the vibe--whether sitting indoors or out--is neat. Gotta love all those hanging plants. 

Among beers tried are the Gnatcatcher IPA, Tiger Salamander Saison, and Monkeyflower Double White Ale. All are solid brews. I have yet to sample the food menu from Yona Redz, but look forward to it. 

There's usually room to sit on the outdoor patio, a Covid-safer option that offers great people-watching. I love holding a tulip glass of a tasty beverage, seeing folks passing by and eying the place. Thinking at them 'yes, you do want to stop here!' I smile a bit when someone does.
Trivia night is soooo cool. Best kombucha and seltzer. They say the beers are good too!

source.name: Sublime
source.categories: Restaurants, Home Services, American (New), Contractors

review_info.review_text: Food was pretty good, although pretty pricy. I want a restaurant to succeed here, but where is the branding? The name Sublime comes with no info as to what kind of food is served. There is no identity established and no web presence. Even if the sign said, in big letters, "Sublime: Healthy California Cuisine" it would help a lot. To the owner: this is very basic business 101. You can't open a restaurant in 2015 without a website and a name that hints to the consumer what type of food you are serving!
Awesome coffee! Nice cafe in the area, looks like the menu is changing since they opened. Good to have a place to grab a beer and dinner on Milpas.

Sublime is new, okay we get it, but methinks a place should have their ish together just a smidge before opening their doors.  

Ambiance - sterile.  

Service - servers were nice, but slow and clueless.  They could not answer a single question about anything without having to run to the back to ask someone else.  

Food - decent enough.  I enjoyed the sage chicken.  My friend had the $40 steak dish (which I see is no longer on the menu) and the steak was juicy and delicious.  Congrats!  You made a yummy!  However, they use Miracle Whip in their deviled eggs.  Rewind....whuuuut??  Ew and moving on.  I looked forward to trying their tiramisu and after the server hyped it up, he told us it was not ready for the eating and wouldn't be until the next day.  Tiramisu tease!

A place that charges $40 for a dish should NEVER have Miracle Whip on the premises!!!  Where is your pride?!  Ohhh yeah, it's at the bottom of that jar of Miracle Whip.  It's miracle if they stay open, and it certainly won't be attributed to my returning patronage.

source.name: Javan's
source.categories: Sandwiches, Restaurants, Burgers

review_info.review_text: Sigh ... Javan's is no more :'(  I miss it already.

It perplexes me that this place is always so empty. Honestly it is the best food in IV without a doubt and it's because the owners double as the cooks and are invested in the overall quality of their ingredients and product. They are always entertaining and you could learn a thing or two from just conversing with them during your lunch. Consider helping out this humble mom and pop shop before heading to a big franchise restaurant because they do not compromise anything in their menu and are competitively priced compared to the rest of IV. 

I would recommend the Tuna sandwich for it's delicious combination of dressings and tastiness of the fish. Every bite is savory and leaves you wanting more. You can't go wrong with any of the sandwiches really though.

The owners of this place should seriously consider investing in a good quality sign for out front.  Currently they have an unlit vinyl sign so the place is basically unnoticeable, especially at night.  I bet they would really see business improve if they weren't cheap about the sign.

Good sandwiches and chili though.

source.name: Elements Restaurant and Bar
source.categories: Bars, Restaurants, American (New), Nightlife

review_info.review_text:
Is this place run by high school kids?

Took the time to make a reservation for New Year's Eve a month in advance as this restaurant has had special significance for my girlfriend and I.  Well dressed and looking forward to the prix fixe menu we walked in at 9pm to a half empty restaurant only to be sat on the patio.  Upset that after making the reservation so far in advance we were sat on the chilly patio.  I protested to the hostess only to be told that the empty tables were "reserved."  This is where I became enough of a pain in the ass to get the table we reserved.  It is worth noting that the restaurant sat half-empty for the entirety of our meal.

After being reseated inside we began the prix fixe dinner only to have food, obviously produced en masse and lacking attention to quality, thrown at us with such rapidity and voracity that we were almost unable to taste its run of the mill composition.  Almost.

Add to all of this an obnoxiously loud bartender and a waitstaff more interested in taking numerous cigarette breaks, and I'm very lucky to say that we managed to have an amazing and memorable evening DESPITE our experience at Elements.

It is also worth noting that this restaurant is up for sale and I surmise that the current owner, possibly already in retirement and looking for someone to reinvigorate Elements, has handed over the reins to his inept staff.  This once wonderful restaurant seems to have gone the way of the dogs.

Came to Elements with a couple of friends for Brunch on a Sunday morning, mostly for the bottomless mimosa. There were 5 adults and 1 child, but only 4 adults ordered food. The food was average- nothing amazing. Once we got the bill we noticed that they had already included a 20% gratuity to our bill, which was fine. But once we got home and compared our receipts/ bank accounts we realized that they added an ADDITIONAL gratuity once we left! Very sneaky. Only thing I'll be returning for is a price adjustment.

This is really a 4 1/2 star rating...

ambiance: cozy, quiet, beautiful view of Sunken Gardens
service: 5 stars- attentive, helpful, friendly, prompt
Drinks: 
wine by the glass: lacking in depth.  Didn't have any cocktails but the list looked great.  Need to come back and order the Firetini that seems so popular.

Food: fresh, crispy but soft bread with creamy butter brought to the table.
Appetizer: ceviche with tortilla chips- thick, super-crunchy chips, ceviche light and flavorful
My entree: panko-crusted swordfish with saffron basmati rice, red and green peppers, and thai coconut sauce- delicious, not heavy, lightly breaded and perfectly cooked.
Hubby's entree: duck breast and sausage with lentils which was rich and very flavorful.
Side: truffle fries with ketchup- yum!  very generous portion.

overall: 4 1/2 stars, will certainly be returning!

source.name: Peabody's
source.categories: Bars, Nightlife, American (Traditional), Restaurants

review_info.review_text:
The last time I went to Peabody's I had such a good time I just had to write a review.  Here's what happened:  I was sitting at the bar drinking a beer and eating some nachos when this gorgeous girl, Katie, and her friend walked in. They sat next to me and I noticed that Katie had the same phone as me, a crappy freebie phone they give you when you lose your iphone, and so I said, "Hey I like your crappy cell-phone, did you lose your iphone like me?"  As it turned out she had.  We swapped stories about how we had drunkenly lost our phones and after that we just kept talking.  She was making me laugh telling raunchy jokes and I was trying to impress her by weaving beach volleyball stories into the conversation.

The whole time the bartender kept our drinks flowing and made sure we were having a good time.  At one point when the conversation ran dry and I was about to pay my bill and go. Luckily I got the signal from the bartender, "stick around, this girl likes you." I'm hopelessly ignorant to the subtle signals of the opposite sex, and if I hadn't taken his advice I probably would have blown it.  We kept talking for a while and I finally asked her for her number.  Not only did she give me her number, but she walked with me to my car, gave me a kiss on the cheek, flashed me a smile, and made sure I was going to call her.

Needless to say, I did.  We met up a few days later for drinks and we had a great time.  We've been hanging out pretty steadily for a few weeks now and things are going really well.  I had to write a review and thank the guys at Peabody's for hooking me up.  I'm a regular at Peabody's now for sure.

My girlfriend and I were staying at the hotel behind this restaurant and decided to try it out after a long day of shopping and sight seeing. After reading some previous comments about service, we were a bit hesitant but decided to roll the dice. We were pleased to find that this place stayed open till midnight on weeknights. We arrived on a Thursday @ 10:30 p.m and were quickly greeted and told to sit anywhere we wanted. We sat next to a warm fire at the fireplace in the lounge but waited a very very long time for someone to take our order........we immediately started talking about the poor service stories we read earlier. After waiting for an eternity, I was forced to walk our order to the bartender (Warren) personally which he promptly took care of. We received our food and drinks in a timely manner and found the calamari and sliders to be hot , fresh, and very tasty. Again, we found ourselves searching for a server to refill our beers but to no avail and ended up walking to the bar for service. Although we found the service to be substandard as we read earlier.....the bartender (Warren) eventually personally came to our table and apologized for us being neglected and without hesitation offered to buy us a round of beers and shots of tequila. With that said, the service was as expected (we did get there @ 10:30 p.m. though) the food was very good, and Warren going above and beyond any other bartender ever has for us made our evening a very enjoyable experience. We highly recommend this restaurant and ask for Warren - he'll take great care of you.

ugh.... this place is horrible.
          I have been here many, many times I can honesly cant remember a plate that I ordered that was any good.  Whatever you do, do NOT order any pasta.  Its rubbery and microwaved every single time....
      This is a real bummer because my wife and I went on our first date here and to be totally frank, I still have no desire to ever return.
      This place is totally avoidable....

review_info.review_text: PERMANENTLY CLOSED!!!!!!  SEPTEMBER 16, 2021.....I met a girlfriend today to have lunch and there is sign on the door saying the restaurant was permanently closed and thanked everyone for their support over the years. Not well presented: salmon avocado roll was huge instead of 8 it was 6 not not chewable. Crunch shrimp was not good either. Disappointed too big and unwieldy.

The ramen and soup here is pretty good. Every time I come I usually either get the spicy seafood ramen or the beef curry ramen. I got the beef curry ramen this time and the flavor definitely tasted good. The only thing that was a little disappointing was the lack of beef it had. They only gave me a few cut up pieces that were really small.

review_info.review_text:
Great simple sandwiches for really affordable prices. 
Recipe: Lettuce-tomato-mustard-mayo-patty/burger. 
That's it! That's as complicated a sandwich can be! I don't care exactly how a subway employee makes my sandwich. I just want to answer two questions in a sandwich shop: 1. What sandwich? and 2. Cash or card?

I have eaten many sandwiches at this place over the years. They make a solid sandwich with good bread. Unfortunately after my last experience there I will not be back. The lady that works there is always rude. I have tried to be nice and she's just rude. I'm over it. I don't need an attitude when I am spending my hard earned money.
This sams to go is great. Open when other delis are not. Food tastes fresh, service is a+

review_info.review_text:
Super Cucas is really tasty and the portion sizes are so generous. They're also open late which is always great when you're in a college town. I love that they have a menu that offers every style of meat veganized (including soy pastor!) 

I'd love to try the vegan fries with meat (asada fries) and the breakfast burritos on my next visit. The portions are huge so I would recommend splitting or saving for 2 meals.
Literally experienced the worst costumer service. A man yelled at me because I told him I was allergic to beans which I noticed were on tacos and asked if they can re-make them.

Decent food, but they always mess up our order. Super disappointing when we pick up food then get home and realize they gave us the completely wrong thing, especially when it's covered in cheese and my boyfriend can't eat dairy!!!! Not the best customer service either

source.name: Choppa Poke
source.categories: Restaurants, Asian Fusion, Food, Poke, Hawaiian, Seafood

review_info.review_text:
Choppa Poke is in a plaza with a big parking lot. I came here on a Monday night and there was no wait time. 

I ordered a medium bowl which was VERY filling! They are extremely generous with the portion size and especially the protein scoops (which most poke places tend to skimp out on). The fish and all the toppings were fresh and overall it was really delicious. 

Choppa is more expensive when compared to other poke places; however, the price is justified by the fresh fish and generous portions! Will definitely come again(:

WORST experience ever. If you wish to be humiliated, do check them out.
 
Ordered their poke bowl in english and dined in with my husband. Thinking we could not understand mandarin, we later heard one of the female employees speaking to her colleagues pretty loudly about us and mentioning how disgusting we were as customers. In her exact words "Those two people who just came in, one male and female, having a bowl of poke bowl. Don't you think they are very disgusting?"  

I was extremely astonished to hear what she had said given that we did absolutely no wrong. And still find it puzzling why she would have said that. While we did not confront about the issue, we later walked over and spoke in mandarin, to let her know we understood mandarin too.  I guess it's just having a certain amount of basic respect and EQ to not badmouth about your customers so loudly. I hope the boss of this outlet is reading this and would educate your staff about customer service.  

I've never felt so much humiliation while dining.

Located next to Kyle's Kitchen across from the Costco Center, this place offers up delicious poke bowls with all the fixings. I get the medium, which comes with 3 scoops of protein. For me, that means 2 scoops of fresh ahi and 1 of spicy tuna. Like all poke bowl spots, be careful if you order any mayo sauce options as you will quickly be asking for poke with your mayo. I like some ponzu sauce and a touch of wasabi mayo to go along with almost all the toppings + extra ginger. It's always fast and mostly polite service. 

I do feel compelled to dock a star for the prices. A medium will run you $20 with tax. Considering it's delicious and healthy, I'll splurge every now and again, but I'm just not sure how long it can survive. So far so good and I'm glad it's there. Definitely worth checking out.

source.name: DJ Flamezz Entertainment
source.categories: DJs, Party Equipment Rentals, Wedding Planning, Nightlife, Event Planning & Services, Audio/Visual Equipment Rental, Party & Event Planning, Photo Booth Rentals

review_info.review_text: Jose (DJ Edu) did an amazing job DJing our wedding! He took the time to work with us on a special first dance song that he custom mixed. Not to mention the DJ Flamezz crew was super accommodating in holding a new wedding date for us for a whole year dealing with COVID postponement. All around we had such a great time at our wedding and could not have done it without them!

I can't say enough about Joe!! He is amazing and very personable! He walked us every little step of the way and made it so much easier than originally thought. He knew what we wanted from our ceremony on the beach, to the cocktail hour before our reception and most importantly made our reception a very memorable night!! We love Joe and highly recommend him!! We received compliments from all of our family and friends who attended our wedding!! They had such a blast and didn't want to stop dancing!! Thank you, Joe for making our wedding a night we won't forget!!! :)

source.name: Café Lido
source.categories: Italian, Cafes, Mediterranean, Restaurants

review_info.review_text:
Came here for breakfast since it was open decently early in the morning. The place is beautiful, but some issues with the bill and somewhat the food.

I had both the Crispy Yukon grilled potatoes, and the Lido's breakfast sandwich. The potatoes were delicious, and I found them to be more delicious than the sandwich. The potatoes also had a very generous serving.

The main issue I have, is the 20% service fee that is automatically added to your bill. It's not stated anywhere on the menu, or by the servers. Now I don't mind paying a 20% service fee if I was aware of it, but this restaurant does not notify you about it. Do not be fooled. Add tip on top of this, and you have a fee that's almost 40-50% of your meal. Would not come again.

New hours and the system as of Sept 5...now the restaurant is open for breakfast from 7am instead of 8.  Also, you can place your order with a server if you're dining in (instead of lining up at the bar counter).

The catch is...if you would like to dine outdoors, you'd have to wait till 8am when the pool opens.  Also, be aware it gets very busy between 9am and 10:30sh weekends as usual.

All servers are consistently good, friendly, and efficient!

Their lunch and dinner options are good as well.  I was going to have dinner @ Costa, but ended up eating (mussels) here after seeing someone else's meal.  ;)

The food is OK. The granola was not bad. The date shake was so so as well. It really got to me was it took forever for the waiter to come to the table. 

I'm top of that I can't stand companies that demand 20% gratuity regardless of service. I understand if it's a table of six or more etc. or even demanding 15 or 18 percent. But as someone who typically tips over 25% when I am demanded it really bothers me. If this has to do with fair wages then raise the prices of the items. Then you leave it up to the market to decide. But there's nothing posted anywhere that says a mandatory 20% tip. That's my other problem. If you're going to require that we need to disclose it on the front door.

Overall, Café Lido has a rating of 3.5 stars. While it offers a pleasant dining experience with delicious dishes, transparency regarding additional charges and gratuity policies could be improved.

The man that works here is so friendly and awesome. The gyro and falafel are great. And I'm pretty sure the pita bread is homemade. Its delicious! I will be back again and again.

source.name: El Taco Tequila Taqueria
source.categories: Restaurants, Mexican

review_info.review_text:
On Thursday night I went to this place after a concert. A few friends and I wanted a bite and a drink. We ordered with a young woman who quickly told us they did not accommodate gluten free customers, even if you wanted a taco or tostada without the bread. Fine. I'll work around that I understand. We waited 20 minutes for our food, granted there was only one guy in the kitchen. We finally got our tacos and were missing one chicken taco and our guacamole. We ask the chef for the rest of our order and he says they are closing the kitchen. I go to the woman and tell her that we didn't get all our food and she tells me I'm lying. I point to the plates on our table to show her we didn't. I ask for our money back and she declines. We end up getting into a fight about one chicken taco and guac. 

I have worked in restaurants before and I would never scold a customer over a $3 taco. I even offed to pay for it and she wouldn't let me. Really terrible customer service. The chef did make us some guac bc I think he felt bad that we were hungry and upset. By that point we had eaten what we were served and didn't have anything to put it on.

That being said the food we get was yummy. Too bad our experience ended on such a bad note.

We both got food poisoning here - that lasted a whole day. We narrowed it down to either the chips & salsa, the queso app, or the carnitas tacos since that's the only thing BOTH of us ate. The food seemed great, but it seems to be all about pushing the drinks for $$ and food safety was left to the sidelines.
Great food. WOnderful atmosphere. Great Happy hour two for one Margaritas. I love the decor too. Beautiful Bar. Amazing flan!

source.name: Itsuki Restaurant
source.categories: Japanese, Restaurants

review_info.review_text:
Absolutely disappointing. As a matter of fact, this experience was so disappointing it caused me to take time out of my very busy life to write my first review ever. 

I'm someone who is happy when there is quantity. So I spend $60 here thinking that should do a good job filling me up (I order the 25$ sashimi bowl and 2 rolls) and I did not get filled up. The sashimi itself disappointed me as well due to the low quantity of cuts compared to kyoto's 25$ bowl. In addition, the fish itself I thought was less fresh. The 2 rolls were also small in comparison to Kyoto's. I'm never coming here again. Man I could have gotten 10 chipotle burrito's with those $60....
This is the best sushi in Santa Barbara, aside from maybe Arigato, which is absolutely not worth the money. Go, go, go!

The restaurant has located to the Camino Real Marketplace area (actually, more like near Pacific Oaks) in Goleta, where Baja Fresh used to be. The ambiance is *totally* different. It's become a big business. They're still getting the hang of how to serve so many people, and seem always to be apologizing for slow service, when it's actually about the same as other places. 

The food was not great the first few times I went, but the last time...yum...they were back on their game. It's worth a try!

It has an average rating of 4.0 stars. Some customers have expressed disappointment with the quantity and quality of the meals, and the perceived value for money. source.name: Metropulos Fine Foods
source.categories: Restaurants, Delis, Food, Specialty Food, Grocery, Sandwiches

review_info.review_text: Really reasonable prices and great sandwiches, soups, and salads. We grabbed lunch here while working remotely nearby and looking for something healthy we could eat (everything else that turned up in my search with greater than 4 stars was Mexican - not a surprise!). I had a half turkey sandwich with soup, and the half was a generous size. While they have some trendy drink options, the rest of the place is kind of old school vs trendy (in a good way). Great lunch spot!

Love this place! Great sandwiches. The little mart is really cute. The lady taking the orders kinda rushed me. Never toasted the bread but they got everything else right. The pb and j was crazy drippy. The chips were amazing

The parking is a bit limited, unless you are here for a quick in and out, but there's parking half a block away. I have avoided coming here because I witnessed an unprovoked PitBull attack on the patio, where the PitBull literally took a huge chunk out of a man's leg. We were all confused, and I'm left traumatized by that experience, with a bloody leg imprinted on my mind every time I see this place. Be forewarned: this is a dog place. Big dog, mean dog, and itty bitty dogs come here with their owners. This spot is very popular around lunch time. The food is slow, so you'll have a lot of folks waiting around for carry out during lunchtime. 

If you order here, you will order at the counter and then they give you a number and will bring out your food. I ordered the OMG sandwich which had grilled chicken chunks on a soft roll, along with a chicken salad. You can do half and half! Which is great to be able to order a balanced meal. 

Overall, I'm still scared of the big aggressive dogs that come here but with a little bit of exposure therapy, I can see putting this place into my lunchtime rotation. 

The food is pretty fresh and tasty. The food is affordable. It was worth the wait and....possibly worth the exposure to scary dogs.

source.name: Casa Blanca Restaurant
source.categories: Mexican, Restaurants, Seafood

review_info.review_text:
My friend and I came here for lunch on Saturday. I am not sure how it is at dinner, but for lunch there was no line so it was fast to get a table. The waiter was very thorough and accommodating. Both my friend and I had the blood orange margarita, which was so good because it had a jalapeño kick! But, don't worry it's not too spicy for anyone that is sensitive to spice, it was just right. 

We both ended up going with the combination plate; me the taco and enchilada and her the taco and tamale. To be honest the only reason why I didn't go with the mahi mahi taco was because it was singular (taco) versus the other tacos were plural in the name (tacos) and so I was expecting to get at least two tacos in the combo. However, only one came so I would ask that the menu be more clear. But, the food was delicious and we even had enough for leftovers. Both plates came with rice and beans too. 

There is an axxess deal for BOGO entree for lunch or dinner as well. So with all the food and drinks we had my friend and I were able to split it evenly for about $24 per person, which I think is a great deal for such a quality food.

Delicious food and drinks! Really fast service. Nice location with a nice scenic patio. They have heaters so you don't have to worry about getting cold. I ordered the burrito and my husband got the fajitas, both were delicious! I also got the margarita flight, which I highly recommend. If you're close to Amtrak on state, I would recommend stopping by!

Ate at the bar tonight for my friends birthday. The bartender Dan, (tall, light and handsome) was attentive and took great care of us! Fast drinks with a warm welcoming personality, a great guy. Good food too! my Bf and I had the tacos.. simple but tasty! Thank you!

review_info.review_text: Great outdoor patio with truly amazing view. Sandwich and salads are fresh and tasty. Great bargin

Unfortunately, I didn't have a great experience here.  Both times, the service has been incredibly slow.

The last time my SO and I came here, it took nearly an hour for our food to come out, and when it did, they brought me a dish I hadn't ordered.  After almost an hour of waiting for food after we ordered, they had to make what I actually ordered.  This took additional time.  The carnitas quesadilla I ordered was actually good, but there were pieces of bone in the pork.

That morning, there was a golf event scheduled at the course, and there were more people than normal.  However, the grill hadn't brought in more people to cook, so there was only one person taking orders and one person cooking.  It seems really ridiculous today that the grill wouldn't have had the forethought to bring in additional cooks on a day which would most definitely see increased traffic.  Waiting an hour for breakfast is pretty ridiculous.

Cafe is open to public (you don't have to be golfing to eat here).
Delicious food! I always get the Ellwood sandwich, hubby always get the patty melt whenever we eat here.
Never had a bad experience!
Beautiful views of the golf course and ocean.

source.name: The Good Bar
source.categories: Bars, Nightlife

review_info.review_text: A nice full bar located inside of the Kimpton Hotel. It is decently sized with plenty of seating and an area to play pool. They are fully stocked with all of the yummy basic liquors to make your cocktail of choice. The drinks are a little bit pricey, but the service is good and atmosphere is nice while staying at the hotel.

In the ultimate suburbia known as Goleta, Good Bar isn't a bad spot to grab a cocktail. 

I've been here several times since their opening. Trivia nights, work happy hours, nightcaps - Good Bar has hosted it all. I dig the hipster vibe and decor scheme, which is a welcomed change to nearly everywhere else in our little town. 

I enjoy the eclectic cocktail selection on their menu. There are also a select few happy hour drinks and food items at slightly discounted rates, and I believe this bar offers a better happy hour menu than its poolside counterpart. 

This place can get pretty busy during peak times, with hotel guests and locals alike. My main gripe would be on the bar's staffing during these periods. There have been times I've ordered food and was forgotten about. My recommendation would be to come here during an off-time, like later in the evening. Sure, the happy hour will have ended, but the extra tier of service received oddly makes it worth the while. 

I will be back.

CLOSED tonight for a private party which is a wedding. I was a hotel guest at the Kimpton Goodland which per the employees is separate from the Outpost and Good Bar. I was a patron as well at the Outpost with a party of 13. Was told to be quite by people from the private party which was a wedding so that their speeches could be heard on the patio which is where they had their dining portion of the reception. Not only did we comply but we shushed others in the restaurant. The wedding guests/party were very appreciative and invited us to dance in the Good Bar where the reception concluded. We went and had a great time dancing until Tyrell the food/beverage manager kicked us out. We kept getting invited in and he kept kicking us out. We did not eat any food or order any drinks, just danced with the party/guests that invited us in. Tyrell kept kicking us out and when we complained to hi. He said "I don't care who invited you in I'm going to keep kicking you out." We told other guests of the wedding we couldn't go in and they said tell the manager to ask the bride/groom who would be fine with us there. We asked Tyrell to do that and he said "No and even if they did say it was ok I still wouldn't let you in." He was very unprofessional and rude. We complained to the hotel front desk and although they offered apologies they also said since they were separate from the restaurant/bar there was nothing they could do. I will NEVER stay at any Kimpton/IHG hotel and once I find out who owns The Outpost and The Good Bar I will never visit their establishments either. Kimpton needs to get this employee under control and teach him about customer service.

source.name: Gladden and Sons Produce
source.categories: Organic Stores, Farmers Market, Specialty Food, Sandwiches, Meat Shops, Delis, Fruits & Veggies, Coffee & Tea, Grocery, Food, Restaurants

review_info.review_text: I love this place, and I too, found it because of COVID as it was one of the few stores to offer delivery when the pandemic first started. I have never had a problem with the staff not wearing masks. They all do and require everyone else entering the store to do the same. I just love everything, including the atmosphere of shopping without a million people around, getting all of the fresh stuff, and feeling like I'm supporting a local, friendly business. Plus everything is yummy!!!

Although the business is trying to do good things for the community .....the prices are really steep....just too expensive and some products aren't labeled with prices, which isn't helpful for customers.

A couple examples I bought:
1 head of cauliflower and 3 carrots - almost $10.00
1 lb of pistachios - $27.00!!!  Yes, that's right....this item was not marked.  As I walked out of the store I saw what the price was but was unable to return it due to their current policy.  Their staff later said there was a chalkboard next to the nuts display showing the prices; however, in the moment, I didn't the prices and still believe it's better to mark each item with a price.

We were not familiar with Gladden until the stay at home order due to covid-19. Since then, we've used Gladden several times for their food delivery service, which I believe is a partnership with Zoomers for Boomers. The produce is good and some of it is organic. The delivery persons wear masks. Some of the items seem to be priced on the high end but overall we're very pleased with the quality and with the delivery service.

source.name: The New Black BBQ
source.categories: Barbeque, Street Vendors, Restaurants, Food

review_info.review_text:
This food truck is out of business. I had previously booked New Black for my upcoming wedding. They skipped town without telling us, taking our $500 deposit with them. After hearing that they had gone out of business from other local food trucks, I tried contacting them several times to get my money back, but with no response. It was not until my fiancé found their personal information (their personal cell phone number and home address) and threatened to show up at their doorstep that they gave us our deposit back. 

For those of you who have them booked for an upcoming event, I would contact them immediately and try to get your deposit back as soon as possible. Sketchy!

They only have three sandwiches available and they were out of one - the Kobe brisket. They recommended the Jidori Chicken over the pork. I wonder if it was because they had more chicken than pork. Either way, it was $7 for a substantial sandwich. I would have preferred to pay $4 for a smaller portion so I could try other things. The sandwich was tasty and the chow-chow was a good complement to the chicken. It could have had a bit more acidity though.

The flavors are good, but with such a small menu, I was disappointed they were out of something before they even opened.

The food is okay.  I'm used to having my BBQ spicy.  When they asked me how I enjoyed it I told them it was okay, I was just expecting some kick to it.  Then they quipped how "If you want it spicy try some tobasco sauce, we wanted to make it good".

I have no idea what to make of that statement.  Besides that, there was not a great amount of choices.  Basically 3 choices, which are all sandwich based.

source.name: Noemi Pizza Romana
source.categories: Restaurants, Pizza

review_info.review_text: By far the best pizza in town! Great toppings, amazing pizza crust and a super helpful staff, what else can you ask for? Their calzone is simply the best, you have to try it at least once! This place is a must, ample parking convenient hours. Try it and you'll be hooked.

There are two things that really bum me out: places that make bad burritos, and places that make bad pizza. Unfortunately, this was the worst "pizza" I've ever had. 
Pizza is one of those foods that should almost always give you joy, whether it's a $3 frozen pizza from the grocery store or a late night slice at a hole in the wall. 
But this pizza (and it was the "soppressata" supposedly one of the most popular) gave us no joy.

This isn't even "thick crust". This is just bad bread with mediocre use of toppings. 

Unsuccessful flavor combination.
Heavy and filling (in a bad way).

I will never make that mistake again.
I just don't understand.. if you open a pizza place, don't you have a passion for pizza? How does one mess that up so badly?

Never had Roman style pizza before and i am thoroughly impressed!!! The crust was incredible, and the ratio of toppings to bread was perfect. The toppings also matched so so well
Different pizzas we tried :
- Bbq chicken : Wow. I'm a huge fan of bbq anything, but with this specific type of dough it was even more amazing. There were some parts that were too heavy with the bbq, but overall i was blown away 
 - Mushroom : Really yummy! The umami flavor from the mushroom really came through
- Potato : Never had potato pizza before, and i will continue to get it from now on. It was so delicious, and the addition of goat cheese was heavenly. The potatoes were cooked to perfection and just *chefs kiss* 

Will definitely be back ! I want to try all the other combinations offered !

review_info.review_text: I wasn't at all impressed by this location. When I first walked in, there was nobody in sight. I noticed that all of the food (especially meat and cheese) seemed old, and crusted over on the edges like it had been sitting for a while. Then I was "greeted" by a younger lady who did not say hi and wasn't the most friendly person. There was also an older lady at the register and after I said hello, she replied "for here or to go".  Both of the employees did not seem happy and should consider selling the franchise. I didn't get a chance to look at how clean the actual store was, so I can't comment on this. I can say that I won't come back to this location under this ownership and I will instead go to the one over by Trader Joe's on Calle Real.
I walked in there, they were almost all out of veggies. Then when I went to get ice for my drink black stuff/chunks were coming out with the  ice so I just bought a bottle of coke.

I would give zero stars if it would be possible .. very unfriendlypeople  !!!it was not pleasant at all to be there !!everywhere else subway is great but unfortunately here.... will never eat again! Dirty place! Dirty tables ..dirty floors with Fett spots!! Was asking for napkins never got some and after we ordered food personal just disappeared and was nobody to ask!

source.name: Maeda Restaurant
source.categories: Restaurants, Japanese

review_info.review_text: A good Japanese meal at a good price. However, I wouldn't bother with their 'Thai' menu. I could make their Pad Thai from the box at Trader Joe's. The best deal is their bento lunch combinations.

Had a craving for salmon, and was thrilled to find this place. Came in and ordered 2 orders of salmon sushi. The waiter gave me one of those faces where you're pretty sure he didn't understand, but it'd be kind of awkward to ask if he didn't understand. So he returned a while later with spicy salmon rolls. When I explained that wasn't really what I had ordered, he returned to the kitchen, then came back a minute later to explain they'd used up all the salmon on the spicy rolls. 

Fuck those guys. Two stars!

OK - let me preface this review by saying this: the term "all-you-can-eat" and sushi should NEVER EVER be in the same sentence.  The point of sushi is that it's fresh, prepared to order and any place that has "all-you-can-eat" amounts of it, is certainly not giving you anything quality.  Now I can't comment on this sushi in particular because I didn't have any (nor would I ever, anywhere) - but the Thai we had here was fine.  I had the Japanese curry which was way too soupy (not like mom's) and tasted the coconut.  Bot were so-so.  We were headed over to the Arlington Theatre to see David Byrne so were in sort of a rush but this place didn't do much to impress.  From the slow service to the waitstaff basically tripping over themselves, it was just an average experience at-best.  Cheap but not so good.

source.categories: Specialty Food, Breakfast & Brunch, Restaurants, Juice Bars & Smoothies, Food

review_info.review_text:
I will only give this place 2 stars because of their variety of choice and the size of the bowls. That's about the only thing that is epic about it. I got the Rincon bowl, which seemed to have the potential to be amazing, but it definitely fell short.  Not very sweet--and if you're not into sweet stuff, not very memorable period in my opinion.

Also, the customer service was terrible. Went in and the worker strolled on over to the cash register and it felt like she was more so forced to wait on us against her will, rather than was being paid for it. My friend left her purse in the shop, and when we called back 7 minutes later, the lazy workers did not even check the floor for us, but said that no one had seen a purse. We came back in and found the purse sitting right where it had been accidentally left--on the chair, in plain site. 

I will never return to this place unless they add some kind of "epic" secret ingredient to their establishment and live up to their name--and I doubt that the food is actually what NEEDS to change.

Save your money--find something else to spend $10 on.

I am on a 30 day juice fast and I was visiting Santa Barbara. I havent had alot of juice outside my home but, when I found Epic Bowl all my problems were over. I had the Superfood Drink and it is amazing. The people that worked there were so helpful and they even gave me the recipe for the drink. Very nice. Please follow me as I juice for another 8 days. Ive lost 25 pounds and I feel amazing.
 
http://www.facebook.com/pages/Juicing-for-a-change/276098682501394

No stars! Bought a Groupon for this place. Have literally tried to go 5 times and it is ALWAYS closed. The hours on this yelp page are wrong. I went yesterday and the guy said they closed at 4pm, even though his door was still open. Not even interested in trying the food at this point.

source.categories: Sandwiches, Restaurants, Caterers, Soup, American (Traditional), Breakfast & Brunch, Delis, Event Planning & Services

review_info.review_text:
Came here for the 1st time on a whim. Had jury duty, and did some research on places to go at.. this place was just 2 blocks down, so I decided to try it.
Ordered the chicken kabob.. delicious!!! 
Kinda hard to understand the cashier cus of his accent... 
portion is generous..left feeling full :)

I have only had a breakfast muffin sandwich.  It cost $4.99 and was loaded with scrambled egg, cheese, and your choice of meat.  I selected bacon.  I liked the sandwich and it came out quick.   The english muffin was hearty and soft, yet well toasted.  The place itself has ample seating (indoor and out) and two televisions.  I came in the early hours of the morning so it was practically empty.   The selection of candy and snacks was good.  Plenty of beverage selection, bottled, fountain, and tap drinks.
This is always our stop while traveling through. The flavors are as fun as the sandwich names. I love the different creations they have come up with. I highly recommend!

review_info.review_text: Came here after taking the morning train to Santa Barbara.  What a cool spot!  Just across the water and friendly staff are awaiting you.  Decent menu for the morning crowd as well.  Pretty busy even on a weekday.  Food and service was great.  Killer spot to take in an enjoyable meal to an adventure in Santa Barbara

Please note: this restaurant is no longer open for business. The phone goes to voice mail and requests you to make a reservation and leave contact info

They will NOT be returning your call. Kind of irresponsible on their part to not honestly let patrons know that they are no longer open 

The website still lists their hours and indicates that they are active and open 

THEY ARE NEITHER ACTIVE OR OPEN, BUT THEY SURE ARE DISHONEST AND DECEPTIVE!!!!

Food and service is solid 5 stars - the pastas were each delicious and compared with some of the best Italian restaurants in NY / SF / LA etc. They clearly care about quality and crafting flavorful dishes. Please keep up that standard. Looking forward to being back any time I'm in the area!!

review_info.review_text: Smelled nice, like bbq, when I was checking in lobby. Restaurant is right next to the lobby. Came in next morning for quick bite to eat. Ordered pancakes, eggs over easy, banana bread, coffee, and a shot of espresso. Coffee was nice and bold for those who love coffee! Espresso was a hearty portion size! Pancakes were thin and tasty, eggs were cooked just right! Dining room was spacious, clean, cozy, and ritzy! Staff was courteous and friendly! One thing only, they needed to refill hand sanitizer dispensers, but I carry my own spray wherever I go. Rooms are comfy, clean, and lots of lemon trees and greenery everywhere! Highly Recommended

Great setting. We sat down at the bar and Monday night football was on with no volume. We asked the bartender if she could turn the volume up a little bit because we were the only ones in the bar. She said she wasn't sure. So a guy next to us said no we don't do that. After he left I asked who he was and she said he was a maintenance guy. So I guess the maintenance guy runs the bar? She lost the tip on that one. She was not a very good waitress she never asked us our food was she never asked us if we wanted another drink we always had to get her attention. My girlfriend had the shrimp and they were way over cooked not good at all. I had the filet stroganoff. I doubt the meat was fillet but the flavor was pretty good. We ordered clam chowder and it was not very flavorful I wouldn't order the clam chowder again. We also ordered a side salad and it was OK the vinaigrette dressing was really good. We ordered an extra order of garlic bread during our dinner and it took about 15 minutes so we sent it back. Overall I would never go back here. The service was very poor and very inexperienced. If I'm gonna spend $150 for dinner and drinks and no one else is in the place I want to TV turned on. The food was probably worth half of what we spent and the drinks were overpriced.

I worked late both nights that I stayed at this hotel and I know the restaurant closed at a certain time but I got there right in the nick of time and they never made me feel like I was holding him up. Alfredo and the other staff were very kind and accommodating!

review_info.review_text: The location on State Street closed down, too bad.  But the one in Montecito is still open and serving great food. Have been eating at the restaurant on State Street for years, but will now go to the Montecito location.

A Montecito local's favorite, this is a relaxing, private cafe with a sweet outdoor patio and nice selection of healthy (some organic) food and treats. The coffee is nice too - they brew Peet's. Enjoy!

This is a fun place for cheese and wine. They have Wine samples and a fan static cheese plate appetizer that includes blue cheese, Brie, and boscottis. Sit outside of you can to enjoy the nightlife as it happens.
Sitting outside watching people walk by is so entertaining

review_info.review_text:
Sad to leave this review, however have been giving the restaurant a number of visits with increasingly disappointing results.   We also have left a few messages for Dario, who never calls

1. Today we ordered a vegetable fasilli and the chicken brick dish. Neither  was very good.  The pasta dish lacked flavor. There wasn't much in terms of vegetables. It was so disappointing

I thought of taking a picture but it really was such a boring dish.  

White beans would give this some flavor and more protein. We've suggested they look at adding some beans to their  vegan vegetarian dishes but have been met with radio silence 

2 The chicken brick dish was not very good. Three people tried it and all were very disappointed. 

I'll try to add a picture of it.  Very little of it was eaten.

3. The bread is an Average plus 

We used to go here years ago and it was pretty good.  I Food today was from the Santa Barbara location on Victoria Street. We've also had disappointing meals At their montecito location.  

We really wish they would spend a little bit more time on their items and their ingredients especially for the pricing.  

Especially given they do not have good vegan options and haven't bothered to get back to us, we think we are done trying.   Ciao Ca Dario

We selected this restaurant because it had an interesting menu with vegetarian options and many positive reviews. In many ways, it offered a solid choice for our party of 10. That said, the overall impression we had was that the food was fairly ordinary. Pasta dishes were served with overcooked pasta and sauces that were unspectacular. Salads were copious, but almost entirely lettuce with lots of shredded cheese. Bread was uninspiring. Only bottled water (not tap) was offered. The one exception was a pork chop that was reportedly quite substantial and cooked exactly right. Wine choices were good, but overpriced compared to other restaurants nearby. Perhaps it was the size of our party, but our overall impression was that the restaurant isn't really trying. At the end of the meal, we had a mixup with the credit cards. Instead of splitting the bill evenly, several of us got credit card receipts for the entire party of 10! This was quickly remedied, but honestly, at this price point, we expected more.

I've been hearing about Ca' Dario for ages and planned to go last year until covid shut things down but I finally got the opportunity to go and it was delicious! The aperol spritz was yummy, the caprese salad was great! My favorite dish however was the ravioli with sage and brown butter! The flavors were amazing :-) make a reservation & try it as the restaurant is quite small.

review_info.review_text: Five stars? People must be out of their minds (not surprising near UCSB). I heard great things about the "old Rincon", but whatever they have done recently has definitely dropped the food quality. This is the most average Mexican food I've had in awhile - that stuff we ate in the '80s at Chi Chi's and Pepe's because we didn't know better and didn't have options. You have options!
Best Mexican food there is by the UC!  Wait staff and hostess are the bomb and so fun and polite. Enjoy eating here every time I am in town.

Had the steak Bohemio and it was fantastic and my wife had a michelada that reminded me of our favorite from Ensenada! Sat in the patio which was nice and really enjoyed the mariachi which comes though and plays throughout the restaurant. Will definitely be coming back, especially when the mariachi is here. Great touch...

source.name: The Lark
source.categories: Nightlife, Bars, Cocktail Bars, Food, American (New), Desserts, Restaurants

review_info.review_text:
Truly a delicious "Shared Dining Experience" here in the heart of the Santa Barbara Funk Zone.

We kept hearing about the Crispy Brussel Sprouts, Winter Beets & Marinated Burrata, Caramelized Cauliflower, Cast Iron Morro Bay Black Cod, Creekstone  Prime Hanger Steak, and the Buttermilk Fried Chicken. With our large group we fortunately got to try them all . . . and each one was incredibly delicious.

Notable wine-by-the-glass which was perfect for the entire meal: Grimm's Bluff, Happy Canyon, Rose of Cabernet Sauvignon.

As cool as this special night was we were seated outside and comfortably next to one of their fireplaces, and surrounded by their portable heaters. 

Our server Laurel stuck with us from beginning to end, and she made sure the food came out promptly, and was excellent with her wine and cocktails recommendations. Can't say enough how thorough she was in making sure our night was special. Also special thanks to host Alberto for keeping an eye on us throughout the evening. 

Highly recommend making reservations to this very special restaurant as it is truly a hot-spot in Santa Barbara. Afterwards Alberto walked us next door to Pearl Social for a continued evening of specialty cocktails.

The food was good to great, where the experience fell apart was in the service.    The restaurant was mostly empty when we arrived yet (during covid)  we were seated right next two other tables.   I assumed the other tables had reservations but remained empty for the remainder of our stay.   The staff was oblivious to the tables they did have, forgetting to recover tables when food was served, ignoring customers waving checks ready to leave, adding plates to our table without removing empty dishes.  Everyone was on autopilot.   It was a real shame because the food was beautiful and delicious.   I would not return despite that.

My partner and I celebrated our anniversary the other night here. It was our first time and our waiter Oscar was friendly and treated us so well! 

Experience: 5/5
We were welcomed with a little anniversary card which was very thoughtful.  The outdoor seating area was really nice and there were heat lamps to keep us warm. The food came out in a timely manner and when we were done with everything, Oscar brought out some complimentary pours of rose to celebrate our special night. Thanks Oscar, you're awesome!!

Food: 4/5
We were brought some popcorn to snack on before the meal. Not sure what the seasoning is but it's really good! The mushroom tartine we ordered was also great and probably my favorite item of the night. Brussel sprouts were delicious too but the sauce was a little heavy for me. Lastly, the famous boneless fried chicken was tasty but not the best fried chicken I've ever had. Maybe I just prefer bones-in. I enjoyed the various dipping sauces on the plate as well.

Drinks: 5/5
My partner had the black Manhattan and I had the gimlet and both were very good, no complaints.

Definitely want to come back to try everything else on the menu!

review_info.review_text:
Delicious chicken enchilada.
Tostada was generous and in a fresh shell/bowl.
Chicken piccata was good but very expensive for the size of the serving. That wasn't a good food value.
And .... Oops.... Their liquor license is currently suspended. Lots of room at the bar these days.
This place is my go to for relaxation after work on on the weekend. Best food and drink selection. All the employees are very friendly and the owner Alfredo is a gem.

This is a local dive and popular around happy hour. They have awesome margaritas and decent seating outside. The staff is always pleasant. The food is another story. Since we usually just go for drinks and chips (good salsa) I can only speak for today's dinner. The food is expensive. $16 for a tostada. We decided to split it. The staff split it in the back and brought it to us on two plates (again, the staff is great). The quality?  Not good. I thought for sure it was canned chicken, the beans definitely right out of a can. There was nothing to substantiate a $16 meal. I would have complained if it was $5 cuz flat out it wasn't good. They refunded us the $16 for food and we happily paid the $36 for drinks. Go for the drinks and target the days when they serve free appetizers during happy hour. You'll never be disappointed.
